Beach, shops, restaurants/cafes and bus close by.

However, there are some big problems with the apartment.
There are three flights of stairs (no lift) to reach the apartment.
There is a major roof leak, with HUGE patches of mould, even requiring a bowl to catch the drips.
Cleanliness was an issue. 
- The cleaners left several items leaving one unsure how clean the place was.
- The bed linen was extremely crumpled making it difficult to feel confident it was clean.
- The windows are filthy, partially obscuring the fabulous view.
Mal did not meet me, as stated in the ad.
Wonderful

Great location, can see all of Bondi Beach right from the dining table. 
Very close to public transport, shops & restaurants. 
Mall is very quick to respond to any queries.

Aaron
Location is just perfect .. I have a quick response for a couple of details at my arrival so I recommend Mal’s place widely

Awesome spot with a host who is quick to reply and easy going. The location is the key here, it is literally right off the beach. It gets a little warm at night (we were in the peak of summer) but Mal had a few fans that were easy to plug in, which helped a good deal. Bondi is simply the best and this one wins with location.
Mal’s place is in a great location close to everything with beautiful beach views.
The place to be in bondi !!! Really beautiful apartment !!! The best view and two steps from the beach
Great view and location, tidy apartment, requires a little maintenance but would stay again...

Awesome location across the road from Bondi Beach. Stylish apartment with comfortable beds and great kitchen. Previous people have left some ingredients which helps keep costs down (don't buy balsamic vinegar - there are three full bottles there). Check what's in the cupboard before you shop. The only two detractors were out of Mal's control - leak in the roof (he says he's been nagging the strata to have it fixed) and noisy buses bringing endless groups of tourists. Foxtel subscription seems to have expired, but maybe we just didn't know how to operate it. Fast WiFi internet. Overall a very pleasant stay.
We enjoyed our stay at Mel's Bondi apartment. It had a great view and was in a perfect location for enjoying Bondi. Mel was quick to respond and a great host.
Nice apartment in Bondi, incredible location & view

The view and location are fantastic.
The apartment is on the 3rd floor and there is no lift, but it was not a problem for us.
The apartment was excellent value for three people.
The washing machine and dryer are not located in the apartment, once again not really a problem to go up to the next level.
The leaking ceiling and mould is a major problem.  We didn't get a lot of rain, but the floor around the sunroom bed was very wet.  Not sure what happens in winter?
The toilet seems to have been "broken" for weeks.  Hopefully, fixed the day we left.
Mal was excellent, responded quickly and helped with any problems.

Luxury is probably not the word I would use to describe this flat. Yes, the view and the location is top notch. But a mouldy hole in the roof when it’s raining (and not informed about in the ad) and sleeping in a bed that feels it’s in the middle of a roundabout is not five stars. Great roof terrace though, and short distance to everything North Bondi has to offer. But the flat needs a proper clean up. Cupboards and wardrobes were also a mess.
The place was beautiful, clean and in the perfect location for all things bondi.

Mal is an excellent host. He had a welcome binder with great suggestions for the area and on top of that was super responsive when I asked for additional recommendations. Also, could not beat the view or the quick walk to the beach. Something, I've seen, but did not fully appreciate till getting there, is that Bondi is a busy neighborhood, so you can hear the traffic info the night, but I've stayed for just about a week and after second night was pretty used to it, though I wish I could open the windows and listen to the ocean instead -- that was the dream before coming
Perfect location, postcard view, and a great feel to the place. Mal's communication was spot on, we would definately come back again. Marc, Hamish and Sophie
Exactly what is was portrayed to be. Enjoyed out stay

No problem communicating with Mal, check-in easy etc. Apartment spacious & well-located. Plenty of hot water for the bath, and loved the Epsom salts after a big day of walking. Gas heater kept me warm. 
But the place itself felt a little stark and empty on arrival - no sign of the attractive sofas and colourful rug and cushions, lamp etc that feature in the lovely well-lit wide-angle photos. A couple of non-functional/broken light fittings, some random objects lying around as if forgotten, unopened mail, scrawled-on sheets of paper, a half-full kitchen tidy, the kitchen-wipe scrunched up and a bit smelly...All very minor deficiencies, I know, but cumulatively a little unwelcoming, and not what I’d call ‘luxury’! Also I didn’t realise quite what a busy noisy road the flats are on (noticeable if sleeping in front room) . But having said all that, the beds are comfortable, the sheets and towels fresh and good quality, the view a pleasure, the kitchen really well- equipped, and the roof top a delightful spot to catch some winter sun and sip my coffee. Enjoyed my stay.
AMAZING place!! Highly recommend for people wanting to run City2Surf! Beach is literally right in front of you when you wake up!! Perfect location and definitely so much value for money!
Incredible! Lovely location, and a stylish comfortable apartment
Wonderful place. Highly recommended!

Great Host
Great house 
Enough said
Great location and fantastic host! Highly recommended!
Will be back, great place.
Awesome location. Nice and tidy.
Great location, and good local amenities
very nice place. very good host.
Perfect location for Bondi Beach. Great view. You can walk everywhere. Quick Uber to the wharf.
Great location

Great pad. Fantastic location. Thanks for the local tips 
Blanca was a surprise packet and just love North Bondi fish
Just do not believe the photos.

Mal’s communication was so appreciate by me during my stay. His prompt responses meant I felt welcome and looked after despite us never meeting. The home is a great location from the beach - there’s no excuse for not having multiple swims each day! I’d recommend Mal and his home to friends and family
Mal is so kind and warm hearted, he gave us a lot of advice about local shops. And the view outside the window of the house is fabulous, we will definitely choose to stay here again if we come back.
Great!

The view is second to none. 
A wonderful spot in Bondi.
You pay highly for the views .

Mal’s place has it all and is a must stay. You are steps away from the beach and all the restaurants/bars/cafe. Clean and has all of the amenities you need if you don’t care to go out. If I come back to the Bondi Beach area, I will be looking to book Mal’s place again.

name: Modernist Urban Retreat
summary: Located in an iconic building in Elizabeth Bay on Sydney Harbour, meticulously redesigned with high quality finishes, fittings and furnishings my home in Sydney is the ideal urban retreat a step away from the uber hip Potts Point precinct
space: With only two apartments per lift on each floor there is a complete sense of privacy, in this iconic Harry Seidler building. There are widows with views in each room, natural cross ventilation and a seamless flow of spaces. A a spacious balcony off the living and bedroom area is ideal for 'al fresco' breakfast and meals. The apartment is located in Elizabeth Bay village and is quite and private in a green setting with lovely filtered views to the harbour. Floors throughout are in Italian basalt with high quality bespoke built in furniture, designer furniture and quality furnishings.
description: Located in an iconic building in Elizabeth Bay on Sydney Harbour, meticulously redesigned with high quality finishes, fittings and furnishings my home in Sydney is the ideal urban retreat a step away from the uber hip Potts Point precinct With only two apartments per lift on each floor there is a complete sense of privacy, in this iconic Harry Seidler building. There are widows with views in each room, natural cross ventilation and a seamless flow of spaces. A a spacious balcony off the living and bedroom area is ideal for 'al fresco' breakfast and meals. The apartment is located in Elizabeth Bay village and is quite and private in a green setting with lovely filtered views to the harbour. Floors throughout are in Italian basalt with high quality bespoke built in furniture, designer furniture and quality furnishings.  Guests have access to the full apartment, including an under cover security car space. Some built in robes will be locked for personal effects. Elizabeth Bay is a small
neighborhood_overview: Elizabeth Bay is a small and  exclusive green harbourside location 10 mins from the Sydney CBD, it is a 5 min walk to the uber hip Potts Point precinct with its boutiques and cool bars and restaurants. There is nothing to not like about the area it is the perfect urban retreat.
transit: Sydney city centre and the Opera House precinct is an easy 20 min walk past parks and the harbour, there is a metro 10 mins walk and buses nearby to take you to the main transport hubs. Taxis are at the doorstep.
access: Guests have access to the full apartment, including an under cover security car space. Some built in robes will be locked for personal effects.
house_rules: No smoking and or pets. Guests are asked to respect the quite amenity of the building. Soft shoe policy. The apartment has stone floors throughout and to avoid sound transmission to the adjoining neighbours guests are asked to wear soft sole shoes within the apartment.

host.host_about: I am a design professional with my home base in Sydney Australia and a 'retreat' in Lucca Italy. This is the place that I come to to keep myself grounded and re tune myself from the pace of a big city.  My home is my sanctuary. I can't live without light so it the most light filled space I could find, with complete privacy and a zen environment. The most important things for me are good friends and a sense of self. The place you live in, the things you surround yourself with are key to the quality of life you have as are good food, art and the places you love.  There are a lot of places one can love but only a few one can call home.

reviews.comments:
Dino’s apartment is presented at an exceptional boutique-hotel standard with additions such as a full working kitchen, laundry and fresh linen. The position of the apartment is in one of Sydney’s most sort after locations and just moments (2 minutes) walk to Sydney Harbour. The view through to the water past the iconic Moreton Bay Fig tree is tranquil and beautiful. 

The man himself is a perfect host whom is both easy going and professional. He was a pleasure to converse with as well. 

The apartment is decorated immaculately in a light and white Sydney contemporary style with controllable lighting, a HiFi stereo as well as a large television in both the lounge and main bedroom.

The main bedroom has a view through the trees from the balcony to Elizabeth Bay and is fairly envy making. You can keep all the windows and balcony door open with no fear of intruders due to the height. That makes it an even nicer space to come home to after a day in the sun.

In addition, it’s the little details that make this place stand out. Things such as a quality iron and ironing board for business shirts, a washer that come with good detergent as opposed to the cheapest and about a thousand fresh towels. It is effectively a luxury home.

I had friends over for dinner and we were stunned at the quality of the kitchen equipment as well as the number of serving platters, tumblers, champagne and wine glasses.

When I lived in the country years ago and nearby, finding a car space could take hours. Dino has a car space with electronic entry. It's the envy of the area and a bonus for anyone hiring a car.

I thoroughly recommend this apartment, which will probably be permanently booked out when people find out how good it is.

Dino was such a great host. The check-in/out process was seamless. The apartment itself was amazing. It was well equipped,  clean and very well decorated. The location is great, as the apartment is centrally located in Elizabeth Bay neighborhood. We had a wondeful time in Dino’s apartment  and would definitely recommend Dino's place to anyone considering visiting Sydney.

Dino was a superb host and the apartment is beautifully presented in a charming neighbourhood close to everything and exactly as it was advertised. The pictures are 100% accurate. Everything was immaculate on our arrival with beautiful fresh orchids in every room - just gorgeous. Very private and secluded accommodation and the onsite parking was a bonus. Highly recommended, we'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Dino's home is such a wonderful place to stay. The unit is superb: nicely furnished, very clean, quiet yet perfectly located in Elizabeth Bay, and it features all comforts of home. It accommodates four people very well. Dino was polite, welcoming host and easy to deal with. We can highly recommend staying in this place.

Dino responded really promptly and was so easy to deal with. He was already in Europe when we arrived, so his friend, Rick let us in and get us oriented. Rick was so lovely and had lots of great tips about the neighborhood. The description and pictures aren't accurate - the place is EVEN BETTER! It's stunning. Absolutely stunning. And so tranquil. We would love to stay there again. And we'd love for Dino to design our apartment!

Dino was out of the country when I arrived so his friend Rick handled check-in and check-out.  All went smoothly.  Rick's a nice guy - very friendly and helpful.

The apartment is excellent.  Spacious, stylish, nice quiet residential block, good location.  A few minutes walk to Macleay Street, pleasant 20 minute walk to the Botanic Gardens and CBD.  

Thanks Dino, I wish I could have stayed longer.

Dino's flat is amazingly beautiful. It's minimalist on it's best. Fully equipped, everything you absolutely need. Kitchen is also fully equipped. It's located in the beautiful Elisabeth Bay neighbourhood, you can pretty much walk to everywhere from there... full of cafes and nice restaurant.

I couldn't have asked for a better experience for my stay in Sydney. Dino was a fantastic host, always accessible and helpful and his apartment is perfectly sleek chic, and in a great location.  Many thanks Dino for a very stress free and relaxing stay.

The apartment in Elizabeth Bay is quite excellent and in very convenient location.  It is very close the shopping street of Potts Point, but a couple of blocks away and therefore much quieter.  The flat faces towards Sydney harbour  and there are glimpses of the water, but it is very private because of large trees outside the windows.   The building is also very quiet and I heard no noise from any neighbours.
The flat is also beautifully designed,  in a modern clean  taste,  with all the facilities one needs for a short or long stay.  It is very well equipped for a comfortable stay with all the facilities one needs for cooking, relaxing and working, with good Wi-Fi.  The flat has the feeling of Dino's own  refined taste, yet with a homely feeling due to books, a comfortable sofa, fresh linen and bedding and a good (Website hidden by Airbnb) covered parking is very convenient and there is also a city bus stop just around the corner.   One could not wish for a better apartment.

Our stay at Dino's apartment was fantastic. The lead-up was straightforward with clear communication between Dino and us. The apartment is very well appointed, with more than meets the eye . The main bed was the most comfortable we have slept in! Location is brilliant with coffee shops, markets and transport close by. Great walks in the early morning around Rushcutters Bay and one morning we walked into the CBD via Wooloomooloo, the gardens and the Opera House. Rick managed our arrival and departure in a friendly and welcoming manner, and I would have no hesitation in recommending this apartment - I am sure we will stay there again.

Dino's apartment was beautifully decorated and was situated in the perfect location at Elizabeth bay. Dino was out of town at the time however his friend Rick was very helpful with the check in and answered all of my queries. I highly recommend staying here and will hopefully return soon!!

The apartment was fantastic- exactly as described and checking in and out processes were both straightforward and easy. It's a lovely, peaceful place; incredible given how central and ideal the location is ! The area is the best in Sydney, just minutes from the best restaurants and cafes, situated right between Elizabeth Bay and Rushcutters Bay- perfect for pleasant walks along the marina. We loved it and would love to stay in Dino's place again.

Dino's place in Elizabeth Bay is fantastic!
Great apartment with everything you need for a short stay. Very modern with fm great finishes throughout the apartment with a great little view of the bay from the lounge room. It's a perfect spot for being close to the city and public transport to get everywhere you need. This is a very busy area of the inner east of Sydney and what I was very happy about is that it was nice and quiet- even on the weekends.

Rick who is Dino's friend who organises the check in's was very friendly and very reliable in communication and it was a pleasure to meet him. 

There is basically nothing to fault with this apartment. All I can say to people is that you should like a very firm memory foam mattress to sleep on. I love my medium firm mattress I have back home and it did take me a couple of nights of sleeping to get use to the great firm mattress Dino has in his apartment.
The bed is fantastic and the heating (including the heated floors in the bathroom)
Is great for the cooler months in Sydney.

I would definitely stay here again! 10/10!

We were lucky to have booked Dino's place last minute as we decided to stay longer in Sydney. The appt is quite popular and there are good reasons for that!

Communication & Check in
Fast feedback and smooth communication although Dino was in a different timezone when we booked. Rick helped us to check in and was real friendly and showed us around in the house.

Location
Was just perfect. Quite central and can walk to all the major popular area's. Also very close to King's cross and Wooloomooloo but the street is nice and quite. Also within 5-min walking distance to good super market and upscale dining. 

The appartment
We are also really big on modern interirors and designs. Dino's the place was a real gem. You cann see that he has invested substantial enegery and money to decorate but also to maintain the place. Top quality materials everywhere, but also top quality amenities. Dino really cares. Everything is custom made and built in, which made the appartment feel real spacious without compromising on the number of facilities. We were with the two of us, but the sofa bed in the study room can cater for another 2 if needed.

Facilities
Everything worked perfectly, but we really loved the floor heating in the bathroom as spring was just starting and Sydney was still quite chilly. Dino also had his own parking space, which was a real plus as parking can get quite pricey in Sydney. 

The bed was comfy and Dino had a nice selection of books and cd's which made the stay really enjoyable as well.
The building and interior is great. And easy to catch bus 311 which can go to the city. Very quite and nice neighborhood areas. Recommend to who wants a quite holiday.
Dino's apartment is just perfect. Beautiful, very well equipped in a dream neighbourhood for foodies. Dino is also the perfect host. Thank you.

Dino was a fantastic accommodating host with a simply gorgeous apartment. Totally professional and wonderful on all levels.
This apartment is a MUST..
Lovely apartment and location. A friend of Dino meet me to let me in and the place was perfectly clean and welcoming.

We had a lovely time during our stay in Sydney in Dino's apartment. It's a great location with a view through the trees on the harbour from the 5th floor. The area is superb with restaurants, bars and a grocery store in walking distance. The apartment itself was super modern and stylish - just what you expect from an architect - and looks just like in the pictures. We were welcomed by Rick, a friend of Dino, who is taken care of the apartment when he is away. Communication was great from both of them and we felt well taken care of. Definitely would recommend the place :)

Hello dino, your Appartement was beautiful - the best we ever had! It's a dream, the place, very quiet, central position, the Architektur, furniture and equipment. Thanks for all. We like to come again. All the best, hans Jörg & jin

We had a lovely time during our stay in Sydney. Dino’s apartment is in a nice quiet neighbourhood and central position. Its an easy walk to Kings cross Train station and restaurants. Wooloomooloo is also a easy walk away.

We were welcomed by Rick, a friend of Dino, who is taken care of the apartment when he is away. Communication was great from both of them and we felt well taken care of. 

I can recommed a good coffee from  “ Poppies “ on the corner owned by a lovely Greek family always served with a smile and a chat!
Many thanks Dino

Amazing apartment. Modern interior, awesome design with well detailed decor. Quiet surrounding with many nice cafe for coffee and excellent breakfast. Smooth communication with Dino, and a big thanks here to Rick for helping us check in late at 11 pm.
Have to say it is one of the best apartment in AirBnb i've ever stay in.

We really enjoyed our stay in Dino's beautiful apartment in Elizabeth Bay and it was very difficult to leave. Dino is a great host and communication is prompt and easy. The apartment is well situated close to great cafes, restaurants, lovely parks and stunning views of the Bay's along the many wonderful walks we enjoyed and not far from the many wonderful sights and venues that Sydney has to offer. We are very fussy with our bedding and Dino's bed is extremely comfortable. I recommend Lizzies next door for fresh delicious food if you want to eat in and Fratelli Paradiso on Challis Ave for great coffee. Our stay at Dino's lovely apartment was wonderful and we hope we will be able to visit again.  We have also enjoyed a stay in Dino's apartment in Lucca Italy last year, both places are beautifully styled (a testament to Dino's good taste and flare for design).  We thank you Dino for allowing us to stay in both places and your apartment in Elizabeth Bay was wonderful.
I've stayed at Dino's place before and enjoyed it again this time. Lovely apartment in a great location!

It's the second time I've had the pleasure to stay at Dino's apartment. It feels like home. Great location. Great amenities.  Super clean. Great Wifi. Great host. There's no better place to stay in Sydney. Thanks Dino! Hope to be back soon.

Great apartment in a very secure building in an upscale neighborhood on the water.  Tons of cafe options, some really good restaurants with diverse cuisine, and parks with a lot of green and great views. Dino and Rick are very friendly and helpful. Wonderful experience.

The apartment is just like in the photos and there are 2 great cafes where you can get the famed aussie brekkies. Yums! Location is pretty good but avoid going through King's Cross station if you are coming back late. Instead, there is a bus (311) you can take from Central station that goes right to the door of the apartment. 

Only downside is that the birds/animals? nesting in trees in front of the bedroom can be noisy at night. Haven't figured out what they are since i always thought that birds sleep at night... But all in still a good stay!

My first Air bnb (being the sceptic who is used to the luxury of 5 stars hotel) and it blew me off. In love with Dino place and all his collections/ taste. Regretted not booking a longer stay. Would love to be able to visit Dino's place in Lucca one day. 
Already singing praises about Dino' s place to friends and will have no second thought about staying there again.
Thank you Dino & Rick.
Great area and lovely apartment in Elizabeth bay. Everything as described. We'd stay again!

Tengo que poner un 10 al apartamento, a la zona y a Dino. Todo han sido facilidades y la comunicación abierta en todo momento. El apartamento tiene de todo. DE TODO. Es muy cómodo, con mucha luz que le hace muy agradable y la decoración y el cuidado con que están escogidos los detalles le dan aún más valor. La zona me ha encantado también. A unos 10-15 minutos de una estación de tren y el autobus al lado del edificio. Lo recomiendo sin ninguna duda. No tiene ninguna pega.

Great location with a modern, clean and spacious interior. Nice views of Elizabeth Bay and close to cafes and all that Potts Point has to offer. Dino was super helpful through the check in and check out process too.
Très belle prestation, bel emplacement de nombreux magasins et restaurants, à proximité du centre et de l'opéra. J'ai pu tout visiter en marchant, à recommander pour une ou deux personnes.
Harry Seidler architectural masterpiece. Great light and inspiring place. Excellent location in Elizabeth Bay/Rushcutters Bay. Very well equipped and maintained. Sydney as its best!

Dino's apartment is great. It's in a neighborhood that is "real" (changing for the better with few tourists) with plenty of great restaurants (we recommend Cho Cho San and Ms G's - both easy walks). His style is appealing, quite minimalist with no handles showing, all white and mirrors, and easy furniture. We appreciated having a balcony to sit on with a glass of wine after sightseeing. Even though we didn't meet Dino himself, communications were easy and efficient and he arranged for us to arrive early after our 17 hour flight from the US (6 AM arrival at SYD). Public transport is very convenient, both bus and train. We walked to Circular Quay to start our first day. We highly recommend a stay at Ithaca Gardens! Thank you, Dino.
Wonderful place, great setup, great neighborhood. Would recommend to anyone staying in Sydney for a few days or a few weeks.
Het appartement ligt in Elizabeth Bay, een aangename, rustige buurt. Winkels en openbaar vervoer kortbij. Als ik in Sydney zou moeten wonen, zou ik zeker daar naar een woonst zoeken!!

Beautiful apartment with an ultimate clean design in a quiet part of Elizabeth Bay. Excellent cafes, restaurants and everything else you need close by. Dino is a wonderful host, communication, check-in and check-out were straight forward and everything worked out perfectly. His tips for cafes/restaurants were very good. His place is fully equipped. 
Apartment comes with a parking space, which is very convenient since parking in Sydney is either tough or unbelievably expensive. Recommend to walk as much as possible, since both public transportation and self driving are not much fun in Sydney. 
Should we be in Lucca in the future, we will try to book Dino's place there as well.

My best ever ABB stay-full stop. All the positive things you'll read in other reviews about Dino's place are true. High standards, amazing location in a quiet neighborhood . Great communication. Highly recommend.

This is a gem of an apartment in much sought after Elizabeth Bay. The very clean and well furnished apartment itself is on a quiet street and has views of the sea. Cafes and restaurants are just a few steps away.

A very nice and stylish flat in a great neighborhood - peaceful but just steps from several cafes for breakfast and a five-minute walk from lots of nice restaurants and shops in Potts Point. We were in Sydney to scout a neighborhood to live in and this was central to many parts of the city. Dino was responsive to queries and his rep in the neighborhood was friendly and available for help when needed. Would warmly recommend the address.

We stayed at Dino's place for three weeks while we moved back from the UK to Sydney. The apartment really is an oasis. Dino has taken a great deal of trouble in its design and it contains every convenience one can think of (including a very marvellous CD collection). It was the perfect base for us. It's location can't be bettered, we don't think. Thanks a lot Dino.

We loved our stay at Dino’s beautiful apartment close to popular cafes, restaurants and bars.  A short walk to nearby parks and approximately a 20-minute walk to the Sydney Botanical Gardens/Opera house.  The apartment is clean, modern and spacious.  We could have easily stayed longer!
Great space in a great location, would definitely recommend it!

Stayed for ten days, good price, location.  Love to walk so enjoyed walking everywhere.  Through Rushcutters to Double Bay, Verona Cinema on Oxford St, Woollahra and Botanical Gardens/City via Woolloomooloo.  Although Uber arrive within minutes.  Would stay again.

Dino's apartment is exactly as described and is well equipped.   The beds are very comfortable and the apartment is well suited to anyone with mobility problems as there is step-free access from the street to the apartment.  

Unfortunately our stay was constantly plagued by noise from works in the building, during the whole 4 weeks.   There was concrete cutting, drilling, hammering, etc, which made staying the apartment during the day very unpleasant.   But it was quiet and pleasant in the evenings.
Great location, lovely decor, responsive host.
Great apartment and amazing location. Handy for everything. Very comfortable and had everything we needed. Highly recommend.

name: Beautiful Bondi family beach house
summary: Stunning luxury beach house just a short 3 minute stroll to Australia's most famous beach - Bondi. With 4 large queen bedrooms, designer furnishings throughout, spacious open living area and a huge private garden retreat with hot outdoor shower, it's the perfect home to unwind in the summer, or stay cosy by the indoor & outdoor fires in winter. Indoor/outdoor dining options and large open living areas make it the perfect place for families, and 1min walk from the best restaurants of Bondi.
space: Stunning tropical beach home just a short 3 minute stroll to Australia's most iconic beach - Bondi. With 4 large bedrooms, designer furnishings throughout and open living/dining with a huge private garden retreat, it's the perfect home to unwind. This North facing, family-sized semi feels more like a holiday retreat than a home. The open plan kitchen flows effortlessly onto a stunning tropical garden that boasts everything you need for a perfect summer getaway - a hot outdoor shower, family hammock, designer outdoor entertaining lounge area and a beautiful dining table which is perfect for long afternoon lunches or sunset dinners.  Located on a coveted beachside cul-de-sac, this dual level semi is just a few minute’s level walk to the beach and to Hall Street’s village café scene and vibrant new restaurant precinct. The interiors reveal beautiful presentation, offering all of the essentials for a comfortable family lifestyle, including four bedrooms and a level lawn for kids to play. D
description: Stunning luxury beach house just a short 3 minute stroll to Australia's most famous beach - Bondi. With 4 large queen bedrooms, designer furnishings throughout, spacious open living area and a huge private garden retreat with hot outdoor shower, it's the perfect home to unwind in the summer, or stay cosy by the indoor & outdoor fires in winter. Indoor/outdoor dining options and large open living areas make it the perfect place for families, and 1min walk from the best restaurants of Bondi. Stunning tropical beach home just a short 3 minute stroll to Australia's most iconic beach - Bondi. With 4 large bedrooms, designer furnishings throughout and open living/dining with a huge private garden retreat, it's the perfect home to unwind. This North facing, family-sized semi feels more like a holiday retreat than a home. The open plan kitchen flows effortlessly onto a stunning tropical garden that boasts everything you need for a perfect summer getaway - a hot outdoor shower, family hammock,
neighborhood_overview: Year-round beach lifestyle At any time of the year, Bondi Beach is a buzzing morning, late afternoon and night-time scene. Enjoy a tasty coffee and some breakfast before walking the Bondi to Coogee coastline. Take in a long, lazy lunch in one of the suburb’s excellent restaurants. Among the dining options is Sean’s Panaroma, a landmark of Bondi culture. It offers a mix of classic Italian and Australian dishes as well as superb views of the beach and ocean. At the other end of the beach, you’ll find Icebergs Dining Room and Bar, with its stunning views. Join the queue at Gelato Messina - it will give you time to make your choice from the daily ice cream specials board. Share family fun meals at the huge range of casual singing options, or finish a perfect day in Bondi with a cocktail as you rub shoulders with popular Sydney stars who call this beachside icon home. Best of all, everything you need is within a few minutes walk, so you'll never even need to get in the car! Bondi Beach Whil
notes: Minimum 7 night bookings.
transit: There is 2 hour limit parking along the street outside the house, as well as a GoGet hire car  located a convenient 50m away. With the beach and Hall streets cafe and restaurant precinct just minutes walk away there is really little need for a car.
access: Guests will have access to all amenities, including the surfboards and herb garden which are located around the side of the house.  The only off limits part of the house is the attic storage.
house_rules: Strictly no parties, no pets indoors, and no smoking indoors.

host.host_about:
Hi,
I am Hannah from Sydney. 
Hope you enjoy your stay in my stunning beachside retreat,
Cheers!!

reviews.comments:
It would be difficult to overestimate how fantastic Hannah was as a host. We arrived in Sydney having been let down only 24 hours before arriving when our previous host gave us a late cancellation. We needed a property that could accommodate five children and Hannah came up trumps.
Hannah remained in constant contact with us throughout that stressful arrival day and offered us her house for the week. She was an absolute lifesaver and rescued our holiday. (For the record, Lisa Peterson of L'Abode Accommodation let us down with the cancellation and never inquired about our welfare throughout our stay in Sydney !)
Onto the house, it was beautiful, well equipped and a perfect location. Hannah and her family greeted us on our arrival and made us feel at home. We did not need anything extra and had a fantastic stay. We exchanged a couple of mails with Hannah during the week and knowing she was available was great.
The shops are close - supermarkets / restaurants and it was quick and easy access to the City. Great spot.
As I previously said, Hannah went out of her way to assist us and we are so grateful. Her house is perfect and if we are in Sydney again, I wouldn't hesitate to call Hannah again. 10 / 10......

Lisa Peterson of L'Abode accommodation was just appalling. Just imagine arriving in a city 12,000 miles from home (Sydney from London) with a wife and five kids and having no accommodation, with it being cancelled just six hours before you got on the plane, but email and with no personalized apology. Then magnify that issue with a host that just didn't (and obviously still doesn't care). This has really affected my view of Airbnb and I am not an advocate of the process, especially as I appear to be unable to warm other travellers about L'Abode Accommodation. I suppose Trip Adviser might assist but Airbnb should consider this for future.

This was our first airbnb experience and it has been super positive. Hannah was very welcoming, sending us a beautiful info pack and answering our questions. We never met in person but felt she was available if we had any questions during our stay. The description of her place is accurate. Hannah has a flair for decorating and gardening and we loved the style of her house. We loved being able to walk to boutique shops, groceries, restaurants and of course THE beach! Our young teenage children would walk home from the beach on their own...Bondi has a hip young vibe and the house was always a great place to return to after a day at the beach or dinner at one of the many restaurants just around the corner. We would rent the house again if we ever return to Sydney.

Hannah and James were excellent hosts. Lots of local information provided and checked in with us every so often to see if everything ok. Clean homely place exactly as described..bigger than photos suggest. Highly recommend

We had great holidays at Hanna's house. The place is beautiful and very comfortable. Specially the kitchen and the garden.  The location is perfect. Hanna was a very good host, very helpful and kind with small details. Highly recommendable to spend holidays with the family!

Let’s start this review on a positive note. The property is a nice size for a family of 4. It’s located in a great area and accessible to lots of amenities and the beach. It’s got great commitment areas (like, the family room and the kitchen ). Hannah is a responsive host, who accommodated our request for an early check in. 

Yet, we got got off to a rocky start. The property had a number of challenges (e.g., excessive dust & cobwebs throughout, bugs, malfunctioning lightning, chipped dishes, moldy smelling & outdated bathrooms, hard to use or leaking showers, etc.). We had to have the cleaners come back and still had to clean ourselves. It’s never good when you discover previous guests underwear under beds and need to treat for ants. 

For the price point, it’s hard for me to recommend this property (regardless of size of home and location).

This was a great place. Very big by Sydney standards and amazing location. We really enjoyed the short walk to Bondi Beach every day.

A few maintenance issues here and there from previous tenants however Hannah was very responsive and helpful when these were raised.
This is the most perfect Bondi location. A great spacious home with a garden and exceptional kitchen space.  Great feel and so close to shops, restaurants and the beach.

HI Hannah,
My husband and I loved our stay in your beautiful home.
The location in Bondi within walking distance off the beach and all the great resturaunts was great thank so much for all your great local tips..we loved Lox Stock & Barrel for breakfasts!

All the beds were so comfortable and we loved your linen sheets.
The kitchen and backyard were so great for long lunches and we loved the fireplace next to the TV for movie nights.

We had such a great stay and really appreciate you looking after us so well.
We look forward to staying again when we are next in town!

Thanks 
Nina

Beautiful and cozy house in the most amazing location, just minutes from Bondi restaurants, shops and the beach! The kitchen was very well stocked, with beautiful little touches arranged for our arrival. We were made to feel very welcome! Having the entire house meant our family of five could relax with enough room! I thoroughly recommend booking this place!

Hannah's home is spacious and very well equiped, especially if you like to cook or barbecue.  Everything was clean and ready for our arrival and she provided a welcome package which included bread, milk and various snacks. While it is very well set up for families, especially those with young children, it would also be suitable to 3 or 4 couples.   It is conveniently located about 5 minutes for the high street where you can find a butcher, a grocer, a bakery and a delicatessan as well a number of cafes and restaurants.    It is about a 10 minute walk from Bondi Beach, so a perfect location for anyone looking for a beach holiday.   Hannah was very quick to respond to our questions and gave us some helpful suggestions as to things to do while we were there.   It was a 5 star visit.
Great accommodation, good location and friendly and responsive host.
Great location, good for a family stay, feels like home
The house is in a great location for access to Bondi Beach.  It is on a quiet street and away from the noise of Bondi.  The house would be suitable for families.

name: Tonight I Sleep in Kowloon City
summary: Enjoy a comfortable bedroom in our home located near the old airport of Hong Kong. Leave behind the crowd and see yourself in a quiet neighourhood with unique urban landscape and great food just around the corners.
space: Land is gold in Hong Kong!! You will be staying in a private room with our family and hope you enjoy the every little bit of space you have in town.
description: Enjoy a comfortable bedroom in our home located near the old airport of Hong Kong. Leave behind the crowd and see yourself in a quiet neighourhood with unique urban landscape and great food just around the corners. Land is gold in Hong Kong!! You will be staying in a private room with our family and hope you enjoy the every little bit of space you have in town. We are a family of 5 (Mom and Dad, my younger sister Miu, my wife Carina and I) with 4 dogs and a cat. Make sure you are okay with them, well I mean the pets :) Whenever you are at home and not out exploring the city, feel free to join us for dinners and family gatherings! Situated near the old Kai Tak airport, planes used to fly just above this neighborhood. You will find old buildings which are only 5 to 6 floors high which are quite different from the rest of urban Hong Kong. But the redevelopment are rapidly changing this area and high-rise buildings are sprouting up everywhere. Let me know if you are carrying large luggage,
neighborhood_overview: Situated near the old Kai Tak airport, planes used to fly just above this neighborhood. You will find old buildings which are only 5 to 6 floors high which are quite different from the rest of urban Hong Kong. But the redevelopment are rapidly changing this area and high-rise buildings are sprouting up everywhere. Let me know if you are carrying large luggage, your point of entry and flight arrival time. We will recommend you the way to get to our home and arrange to meet and bring you home.
notes: We live on the second floor and there's no elevator in the building. Make sure you're okay with dogs and cats before booking :)
transit: Transport around Kowloon City is not the most convenient but it keeps us away from the crowd. Walk up to the nearest MTR station (Lok Fu) takes about 15 mins. There are numbers of bus and minibus to Mongkok (Downtown Kowloon) which take about 10 mins.
interaction: We are a family of 5 (Mom and Dad, my younger sister Miu, my wife Carina and I) with 4 dogs and a cat. Make sure you are okay with them, well I mean the pets :) Whenever you are at home and not out exploring the city, feel free to join us for dinners and family gatherings!
house_rules: Keeping the room as the same as before will call it fine. No smoking inside the house, thank you!

host.host_about:
Come visit Hong Kong, look for the escalators up Mid-levels in Central,  take the ferry across Victoria Harbour, see yourself in the neighbourhood of Jordan and Mongkok in Kowloon, or embrace the mountains in Sai Kung if you are too fed up with all the extravagant stores and shopping malls. This city is always on the move and you can feel the traditions still live among the people here. Seek beyond the modernized appearance and there is always something more to offer no matter what kind of travelers you are. 

From Hong Kong. Love traveling with my pack and passion.

reviews.comments:
This is a real find for anyone trying to find a more relaxed part of Hong Kong, but who does not want to leave the comforts of urban life. Located near the former Kowloon city, you live right in the middle of the nightlife of Kowloon district, with many eateries just down the street. The place is excellent location wise  as there are buses in front of the apartment building. If not, you can make a 15 min stroll (8 min if you walk at a brisker pace) to the nearest mtr station. Franco and his family really made me feel welcome for a period of 3 weeks, this made me re-appreciate Hong Kong on another level. Especially Madam Wong was an excellent host, much thanks for inviting me to badminton, the hotspot was very delicious! 
Highly recommended for anyone wanting to seek some peace of mind and feel/see a slower paced lifestyle of Hong Kong.

I was only at Franco's home for two nights, and didn't get to spend too much time with the whole family, but I generally felt very welcome at theirs ( (*even if their dog Nana didn't like strangers much, their cat, Little Flower, took a shine to me!) - came back in the evening once intending to pop out again for dinner and they invited me to sit down with them for a home-cooked meal T_T and when Franco and Carina had Boxing Day off they invited my friend and I to join them for a day trip to Tai O where we had a lovely day out walking around the fishing village. Franco's mum Win is also super friendly. Basically I'd love to meet them again when I'm back in Hong Kong one day, or if they visit Tokyo...!

Kowloon City is far-ish away from most tourist areas, but it was just right for me since the area is full of cheap and delicious food, and I loved walking around the market, the more traditional provision shops selling all manner of pickles... Their place is probably not for you if you're expecting... I don't know, a hotel or something. It's very no-frills but was perfect for me - I just needed a warm shower, clean place to sleep and some privacy (I had my own room). Be warned about the lack of elevator; Franco and his dad helped me with my suitcase up and down two floors!

Franco's home is cozy place. And the Wong family are really nice. It was a wonderful experience to stay in their home and I will definitely miss you guys. Hope to stay there again in my next visit to Hong Kong.
家的感觉,非常的温暖,喜欢他家的小动物｡交通很便利｡下次还会光顾｡:)

Place is tidy clean and spotless comfortable bed with quiet environment even with two dogs and one cat to live with.the family's host was ever so nice and friendly . I would love to stay in Wong's family again next time I back to Hong Kong

Franco's family was superfriendly.  The room matches the description, the flat is immaculately clean. The bed may be small as it is mentioned in one of the previous references but for me it was comfortable and I am 190. There are good restaurants near the house (thanks again!) and a park nearby. I would definitely stay at Franco's place again if I had such a chance.

Franco is an excellent host and I enjoyed staying at his place even if it was only for three nights. I found the apartment to be just as the advert describes. Franco was communicative before I arrived, and generously met me at the bus stop (A22 route from the airport) to show the way to his apartment. The room and the whole apartment was tidy and clean and I was made to feel at home from the beginning. The whole family is welcoming and friendly and we had many conversations about travel, work, and other matters.

To get around, I used the MTR station (Lok Fu) a short walk away (10-15 minutes depending on your pace) but there are other options (minibus, bus, depending on your destination). The local area has plenty of restaurants so it's easy to find a place for dinner within a few minutes walk, and there are the usual supermarkets and other stores so everything you need can be found nearby.

Before arriving, I was not sure about staying in an apartment with three dogs and a cat, but in fact they were fine. At first the dogs were nervous of the new visitor, but they never jumped up or caused me any problems, so unless you really dislike animals it should be ok.

I would be happy to stay at Franco's place again and can recommend it as a good/clean/safe place to stay. Many thanks to you and your family Franco!

On arrival, our friendly hosts warmly greeted us and made us feel very much at home. They took us out for breakfast, showed us how to get around, where to shop, how to catch public transport, and even spent a day taking us sightseeing. They also did the laundry for us and made sure we were very well looked after. The place is clean and comfortable, and if you like pets, this place is highly recommended. There is a shopping complex just a short walk away, plus many shops and restaurants nearby. we have a great time there with franco family.

With Franco and his family I felt like I belong here. They were so welcoming and thoughtful :) Their house was close to the bus stop, but they still picked me up there. The house was just like what's shown here, and my room was big enough - even the upper berth was spacious enough to have a nice sleep. I didn't actually have to bring my daily necessities; they shared almost everything with me. And we had dinner together, sharing our life experiences. The dogs were quiet and behaved very well throughout the time (they were actually trained). Everything's fantastic!!! I'll definitely stay at Franco's the next time I come to HK.

Franco said I was the 11th guest visiting his home. And I think I am a lucky one. In the 3 days in HK for my LSAT, I received a lot of help and support from Franco and his family.
I recommend you to come to Franco's home if you are to take LSAT, SAT, or TOEFL at HKEAA, in San Po Kong. There is a bus stop at the door of Franco's home and you can take the 11D for only two stops(about five minutes), with additional around five minutes' walk to the test center.
There are three dogs and a cat at Franco's home. It is easy for them to get familiar with you if you feed them occasionally. One dog named Lubi got so familiar with me that she slept on the floor in my room quietly for a night. I hope she will remember me next time I come to visit Franco. 
Life in Kowloon City is both of traditional HK daily lifestyle and exotic. Many Thailanders live around. HK-style Cafés and Thai food restaurants may just open vis-a-vis across the street. And thanks to Franco, I tried the best restaurants of the best. 
Kowloon city is a good place for anyone who just wants to be a flâneur, exploring around the city and experiencing the charming ordinary HK life. And Franco's home is certainly a fantastic place for a rest.
The host Franco and his family with the dogs and a cat named Ah Fah are awesome! The house was clean and has a friendly atmosphere.

It is a very great experience to live in this house with these lovely people,every details in here is  setted up meticulously,even you meet some problem ,these people will help you to solve it. youcan play with their lovely dogs or cat here ,and youcan feel the cozy and warmful atmosphere .I very appreciated these people bring me that great experience here,itisu
nforgettable

It was my first time lived with a family in my journey.And thanks for Franco and his family gave me a very unforgettable trip.They're friendly and another four members are very lovely.I'm sure everybody will have a good time here.

It was lovely and had everything one would need to feel at home. It's easy to find even for someone knows nothing about that area. Transportation and other basis are available within seconds. You can enjoy companion from lovely pets. At the same time it has sufficient privacy as well as space for one to relax. Franco and his mom are helpful and really kind people. I  joined them at dinner with 4 dogs sleeping peacefully. Though there are 4 dogs the house is clean and just super cozy. 
I would definitely recommend this bomb, especially those who need to take exams :)

Franco and his family are soooooo kind and helpful! And I like their dogs named NaNa,Ruby, Muemue(i dont know how tu type this one) and a cute cat named xiao Hua! I think I 'll be their place next time! That's so great!!!!!!

I came back to HK to visit my friends here, especially Franco's family :) I feel like I'm a part of the family. For the last time and this time we shared a lot of experiences. We had dinner together. We walked the adorable dogs together. We went hiking together. And we would share our views of life together :) They made me love HK even deeper and they are the reason that I'll definitely come back again.

I traveled to Hong Kong for just 7 days. But thanks to Franco and his family it became an unforgettable time for me. The room is spacious and cosy. I had enough space to rest, sleep and place the luggage and bags in. The nights were silent. I got an own key for the building and room. The dogs are really nice and the whole apartment is clean. I was growing up with dogs and know what kinda work it is to keep a house with dogs clean. I never found dirt anywhere. The bathroom is spacious and comfortable. I was having dinner with the family and whenever I had a question I got super advise. The public transport system in hk is quiet convenient. If you buy an "octopus-card" in the airport u can use any transport system with it by holding the card on a scanner to pay. U can charge the card in 7/11 (a supermarket which u can find everywhere in hk). The next MTR Station is just 15 min by foot and the next bus stop is right in front of the door. The area around the apartment got everything. Fresh market, supermarket and many different restaurants with delicious food. If you don't know what to eat, ask Francos mom. She always got nice Ideas and can tell good restaurants nearby. I will definitely choose this room again and whenever I'm in Hong Kong I will visit Franco and his family. Francos room deserve 5 of 5 stars.
Franco and family were very helpful.

Franco and his mother were very friendly and welcoming.  Communication before my stay was quick and they helped me easily find my way to their place from the airport. The place was very clean and conveniently located near many bus stops and a 10-15min to the closest MTR station. They let me use their octopus card during my stay. 
I had a great time!

What impressed me most was the kind heart of Franco's family. My stay in HK was so much more than just traveling. I actually LIVED here :) We shared our life experiences and they inspired me with their precious thoughts.

Kowloon City is a traditional region of HK where I experienced local people's lives. Several bus stations nearby are linked to everywhere in HK and I enjoyed sitting at the front seat of double-decker buses exploring this lovely city.

I stayed with Franco and his family for around a month. From beginning to end they were incredibly friendly and helpful. Franco gave me detailed information on how to get to the flat from the airport, and his mum was waiting to welcome me. The room was comfortable and clean, with (much needed) air conditioning. I joined the family for some traditional Hong Kong meals, which were delicious. The flat was fairly lively, with around 6 dogs in the living room during my stay. However, they were all very friendly and well-behaved, and didn't enter the private room. The location is a wee bit out of the way - my commute into Admiralty took around 40 minutes by bus and MTR - but its a nice area. Lots of great Thai and Korean restaurants nearby, and the Walled City Park is just round the corner. Overall had a wonderful time living with Franco and the family. Would recommend to anyone looking for a place in Hong Kong, and hoping it will be available if I'm ever back in the city!

Franco is indeed a super host!! Pre-arrival communication is good with prompt response. His 4 dogs are surprisingly tame and they welcomed me at the doors upon my arrival! The room is cosy and the bed is very comfy too. 

Kowloon City is like a hidden gem amidst the bustling cities in Hong Kong. It is a food heaven with many eateries and fusion cafés located just within 5 mins walk from home. Save the hassle of walking to the MTR station! The bus stop is conveniently located right below his house. 
Franco's parents are very helpful and will patiently explain to me the directions whenever I'm in doubt. I had meals together with his family and visited the nearby wet market to experience the local people's life.

Overall I had a pleasant stay at his house and I will definitely be back again for my next trip to HK.

I had a great time staying with Franco and his family. From the first to the last day, they always took perfect care of me. They are very generous, globally-minded and friendly people and introduced me to many new foods and interesting places that you may not find in any tourist guide. The dogs were fun to be around (Ruby was my favorite, and she knew it), and despite being home to so many pets, their nice apartment was always very clean. The neighbourhood felt safe at all times and getting around town was easy from Kowloon City. Thanks again for the amazing stay. I hope to meet again someday!
来一趟香港去哪都方便的情况下,房主还是很热情的告诉我想去的地方的路线,很暖心!家里住的舒服!感觉很温馨!!

Franco and his family members ( including the dogs lol) are great hosts. They provided me with cosy room and thoughtful care. We even ate dinner together, sharing our different experience. In a word, I strongly recommend you guys to consider here as an ideal stay.    :)
房东一家聊得投缘 整体很整洁 下次再回来

Its a lovely home and welcoming family.
In certain ways its central to HK as a whole, giving good access to the North/East/South/West, either by MTR up the road, or the bus stops either outside, or just a few blocks down the road.
Its a lot more authentic HK than staying in a hotel in HK-Island or TST, and the family invited me along for days out and were always available for tips and advise.

It was such an awesome experience! I came Hongkong to take SAT and ACT test and I lived with Franco's family for 9 days. His mom and dad are so generous and decent. I appreciate  hospitality. They had prepared nearly all the necessities when I checked in such as alternative plugs, towel, shampoo or even fruits and lemonades! They also invited me to taste original HK breakfest and snacks. Lovely pets sometimes could be a bit noisy, but it didn't matter since they are very quite for most of the time. They are quite adorable and docile.

Overall I came away feeling that I had absolutely chosen the right place to stay - I would definitely recommend this place!
The room is small and plain, but the bed is comfy and there are plenty of power sockets. Not really suitable as a place to spend a lot of time, much more for somewhere to stash your stuff securely and lay you head at night.
What really stands out about this accommodation is the family. So generous and helpful, they go beyond what you would expect from a host. We had a really good laugh together and all my needs (and some wants) were catered for.
Yep, if you are a sociable person, this is the place to stay.

Absolutely exceptional experience. Although I didn't meet Franco himself, I was warmly welcomed as a friend and very directly and simply by his family (and the 4 dogs, and the cat). The guest room leaves plenty of opportunity also to hide away and get a calm moments for a productive day of work if needed (a desk is provided), but of course, if you have time, the best is to pop out and simply get ready to receive all the love and attention that could get you accointed with the inners of Kownloon City, with lot of nice surprises (nice HK dessert place, was invited for dinner, enjoyed thoughtful talks, and walking the dogs, and visiting the legendary walled city park by night... etc...). I can only recommend this place. I hope I'll have the opportunity to come back.

入住的時候F正在和太太一起在外旅遊不在家,F家是我入住airbnb以來最熱鬧最有愛的,因為家裡有四隻狗狗和一隻貓貓,真的超級開心!雖然進門的時候狗狗們叫得很大聲,但是不要怕,他們只是在熟悉你的到來,實際上非常的溫順,他們都是經過F的妹妹寶兒調教過的哦. Ruby非常開朗喜歡找你陪她玩,也是一個十足的好奇寶寶,最後大家就只記得她的名字了. 阿妹,娜娜(小名,全名回來就忘記了),還有最膽小的XX我也怎麼都想不起來,好傷心. 回來很想念他們.
第一天晚上回來F媽媽在家,我們坐著一起聊了好久,非常喜歡和F媽媽的聊天,第一次知道了WorkAway的旅行方式,好羨慕她的開放和簡單. 
第二天上午他們一家人邀請我一起早餐,非常地道的港式早餐,超級好吃,等位吃完馬上下一個,雖然很趕但卻講究. 後來才知道F媽媽還要花一個多小時去西貢上班,不知道那天遲到沒有?永遠都會記得F媽媽在國外WorkAway,時刻告訴自己的一句話:我要做得最好,因為我是香港人,代表了香港,不能給香港丟面子. 
F的媽媽很開朗,F的爸爸比較安靜,但是非常的親切,很喜歡F的妹妹寶兒,希望有機會來上海聯繫我哦,帶你好好遊上海!
遺憾的是沒有見到F本人,聽說他的太太和我是同行,相信一定有很多共同話題,期待下一次的見面!
If you are looking for a place where you can feel at home...where you can enjoy real HK home made foods and family environment, this is the place for you!
这一家人非常热情!居住环境很好｡居住气氛也很轻松｡给了我很多的帮助｡帮忙找路线图  又带我去吃正宗的香港早点!真的特别感谢这一家!

name: Well decorated and fully equipped
summary: Comfortable 2 rooms (1 single bed + 1 double bed + 1 sofa) apartment with easy access to the major HK tourist spots. Club house available: pool, gym, sauna, reading room, convinience shop at the building. Free shuttle bus to Hung Hom and Tsim Sha Tsui Stations. Supermarket, restaurants and shops with walking distance. Nice view of HK Island.
space: Very comfortable and quiet Gym, swimming pool, sauna, reading room Very often Nice and quiet neighborhood, well located with easy access to different areas of thw city.
