In the window there is a small terrace. All very clean.
Mayra is a great person, very reliable, and willing to help the first few days.

The room is in a 2 bedroom apartment (the second room had another guest) in a great part of New York city, with lots of restaurants, shops, and pubs right outside and lots of young people having a good time, a friendly neighborhood.  Mayra was a very welcoming host and the room was nice and quiet. I had friends staying at the St. Marks hotel around the corner complaining about the noise while I slept.  The bathroom is New York apartment sized but adequate, the kitchen area is functional with coffee making (my only priority).

A great place to stay!  The complex is a on a busy street with plenty of food and shopping in the area.  But even with all that, it's still very quite in the actual apartment.  Mayra was very helpful and friendly.  Overall, I would highly recommend staying here.  We'll definitely be back!

My sister and I had wonderful days in NY!
The stairs of the building are not too welcoming! But except the stairs the apartament is really lovely, and the room was very VERY nice!! The location is really good too. There is a metro station so close, but the center is not far so we loved to arrive everywhere walking! Mayra is so friendly and kind, very corteous! And also the other guys we met in the apartament.
We had great time in Mayra's room!

I enjoyed our stay at Mayra's home. She was away the weekend we stayed at her place but  the place had a warm feeling (good sunlight and visual space) for a studio apartment sized space. Apartment was clean and located in the heart of East Village. Despite being on a noisy street, the apartment faces the back so it was very quiet as advertised.

The apartment allows easy access all the bars, restaurants, cafes in both the east and west village area. Also, during the weekend, I found free parking west of 5th Ave. The IRT east side subway is just couple of blocks away. It was very easy to get to the Upper west side as well as getting to other parts of Manhattan.

Definitely a good weekend excursion place to stay if you are looking to do alot of stuff in the city rather than spending alot of time in the apartment.

We stayed at Mayra's place and had a great time. Her roommate is friendly, too. We were surprised how close to the center it is and about the good location in St. Marks St, full of small restaurants. The room was clean and everything was there, even if we didn't meet Mayra in person. The only thing that could be improved: The light bulb in the bathroom didn't work and so it was a bit dark.
The reservation was canceled 33 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

My experience staying at Mayra's was fantastic. She was very accommodating and made my stay very comfortable and easy. She communicated very clearly before I arrived, which made getting in and getting set-up easy. Once I was there, she was only a phone call away if I had any questions about the apartment or the area. She also left some Time Out New York magazines on the table which was helpful for checking out local events. Overall, I would high recommend staying at her place - great experience and I would definitely do it again.
The reservation was canceled 29 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Good place to stay for coming to N.Y.C., Mayra is a great host, very helpful, the appartment is located in a very lively street with lot's of small bars around. Overall a great experience, but beware the staircase when you're handicapped.
It's fun to come from the quiet flat to the vibrant Street.
Mayra is an accommodating host and her apartment is really in the best location in NYC. A good option if you're on a budget and just need somewhere to sleep.

Mayra has been a very nice host and her apartment is charming, quiet, sunny and very well located! The roommate is very nice and quite discrete. We have barely seen him twice in a 6-day stay.
Mayra a été une hôtesse fort sympathique et son apartement est charmant, calme, ensoleillé et très bien situé ! Son coloc est très gentil et super discret. On l'a à peine croisé deux fois sur un séjour de 6 jours !

Mayra was a great host. She took us in very last minute and was very helpful and understanding about our situation overall. She's very easy-going, easy to talk to and fun. Her apartment is at a great location, a lot of restaurants and bars on the same street yet you can't hear a thing from her place and the bed is quite comfortable. It's overall a great place to stay and know NYC, with a very loving host. We were very glad to stay at Mayra's, we had a great experience and would definately recommend it to friends!

L'emplacement de l'appartement est idéal pour visiter NY.
La rue est très animée (beaucoup de bars ...) mais l'appartement est très calme et nous n'avons pas entendu le bruit de la rue.
Notre hôte toujours souriante et sympathique fût très accueillante et disponible. Elle nous a donné des conseils et adresses pour les visites (par exemple pour une messe gospel)  et également des magazines. 
Seul bémol : le lit en mezzanine est trop prêt du plafond et nous avons eu chaud la nuit !

Mayra was a great host, very friendly. The room was also great. There was a bed (big enough for two), an air mattress, and a couch; definitely enough room for three to sleep comfortably. I would stay there again.
Mayra was an absolutely great host. The apartment is very bright and very well located. Mayra was very friendly and gave us advice deprecieux for our three-day New York.

My friend and I stayed at Mayra's for 5 nights and have a very mixed review.....

The flat itself is in a great location right in the East Village. Loads of bars/restaurants really close by, great access to public transport and, if you are happy to, easy walking distance to a lot of areas. Mayra's housemate was LOVELY...friendly, helpful and really accommodating.

Unfortunately Mayra had not told him we were staying, so we were lucky he was in when we arrived as the friend who was supposed to let us in was not there. Mayra had another friend who had been staying in the room, so when we arrived her stuff was still in the room. Very confusing! Eventually the friend arrived with the keys, but we were left to change the bed ourselves, the room was a little dirty and it was initially pretty uncomfortable as her roommate did not know we were coming and apparently other bookings had been made without him knowing. Also we were told he would be travelling a lot, he was often away most of the time and we would basically have the apartment to ourselves...not true.

Luckily he was great, made us feel welcome and at home and we had a fantastic stay in New York despite an interesting start. We were out and about a lot so only used the room for sleeping so it was all good; as mentioned, great location...but it felt like the host had not really been that honest with us about the set up before our arrival.

Mayra's place is a very good spot to visit NYC from. THe location is really wonderfull. You can walk or cycle anywhere (which we did all the time) or take the metro of course. It's a compact and light an quiet place with everything you need.

Me and my two friends stayed at Mayra's for the weekend so we could attend Comic Con, and I couldn't ask for anything more! She was a very sweet and accommodating host, and literally thought of everything, including a map to find her place, a coffee maker, and the wi-fi password! It was very easy getting to Times Square since the NQR is right there. Oh, and not to mention, there's delicious, cheap food right on the block. Great experience, I wholeheartedly recommend staying here!
Very nice place and location. It is in the heart of NYC. I will return to this place when I come back to NYC.  There are great places for eating out. Mayra is communicative and helpful

It was a good place to stay if you're staying for a short time. The place was very clean. It was cozy; as mentioned it is located on a very busy street but that business could not be heard from the apartment. Mayra kept in contact which was very helpful. The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 star is because the room was very hot (I know it's fall/winter season but still way too hot). I didn't ask how to control the temp but I'm sure you can control it, if not then bring tshirts and shorts to sleep in. But other than that everything was fine. Probably will be my go to stay :)

Mayra was a great host. The situation of the flat is excellent. Near main subway  lines to go around Manhatan. The street is very cool and East Village is great for dinner with cheap and good restaurants. 
The room is big, thanks to the structure of the bed. Th toilet is really small, but enough. 
Please! Be aware is a 4th floor with no elevator. And it is an old building, so the stairs are high. 
Mayra is very friendly, we never met her, but we were in contact by mail. Provably you will be sharing the flat with Dominic, fantastic guy. You would not notice he is in the flat. 
Our first experience with air b&b was much better as we expected. 
Thanks Mayra!!!!
The reservation was canceled 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Super cool place and location. The bed is comfortable, although getting on and off the loft is a bit difficult. We spent a bunch of time in the room and only ran into the roommate once.

The location was perfect - very easy to get around Manhattan with the subway within 5 minute walk.  The immediate neighborhood had many wonderful places to eat and listen to great music.  The room was exactly as described by Mayra; only saw or heard roommate once during the 5 days we stayed there.  Mayra was in contact to ensure all was satisfactory.  Thanks so much, Mayra.  I would recommend others to stay here.

L' appartamento e' in una bella posizione, un un bel quartiere vicino a moltissimi ristoranti e bar! Mayra e' stata molto gentile e ci ha sempre riposto velocemente! La camera e' carina e confortevole!!! L unico neo le scale per arrivarci... Niente ascensore!

Mayra was fantastic! She was there when I arrived and showed me the apartment and everything I would need to get by. She even then took the time to recommend a list of places to visit and eat while i was in town which was incredibly helpful. The room was great too. Completely private, quiet and relaxing. The apartment itself was situated in a fantastic area, close to the subway and a great place to base my travels from! Would definitely visit again!
Best host ever. Even the place is perfect. Perfect location in a superb surrounding.

Staying at Mayra's was one of the highlights of our trip. The apartment was bright, beautiful and the little balcony (fire escape) was perfect for a morning stretch and coffee. The Apartment is right in the middle of the city and it truly felt like we were one of the local's while staying here (we even became regulars at the bar across the street!).  While Mayra was unable to meet us when we got there, she gave us all the details ahead of time and made it very easy to figure everything out. We had a bit of a mix up at the beginning she was available to answer all of our questions late into the night! We felt very safe and would definitely recommend her spot to others! Thanks again for such a great experience.

Great place (cozy, clean, bright, and quiet), and great location (lots of restaurants/bars in the immediate area, and plenty of public transportation options). Mayra was very easy to communicate with, and was able to accommodate an early check-in time. Would definitely stay here again!

Mayra's place was exactly as described. The room was clean, there were clean towels for us to use and Mayra was an excellent host, always very helpful when we needed some advice of where to go / where to eat etc. The only thing not shown on the pictures is the rather small bathroom, which wasn't a problem at all for us. We would definitely come back to this place! Thanks Mayra!

It was an absolute pleasure staying at Mayra's place. The description was everything we expected and more. It was a great location to bars, great restaurants, short distance to lower Manhattan (which was perfect as we celebrated July 4th at Brooklyn Bridge), and she gave excellent recommendations as far as what to do in town. The room was very clean, presentable, there were clean towels, and we actually ran into her roommate once as we all stumbled in after a night out. She kept good contact with us for what to do around town, keeping us updated on the spots to hit. She was a wonderful host. Would love to stay there again!

This is the best location in NYC. The room is clean. Fitted 2 people confortably. Make sure you have good cardio, because there are 4 flights of stairs. Other than that, it was very quiet to sleep and the fan provided enough fresh air that we even needed a little blanket. Thanks Mayra, we enjoyed ourselves a lot.
La zona donde esta ubicado el departamento es genial! Super recomendable! Mayra respondio a nuestras inquietudes y dio soluciones a nuestros problemas eficazmente.

Mayra was a great host who was very flexible and accommodating during our stay. The location is right in the heart of St. Marks in East Village, it's a very quiet room with a lot of natural light. The lofted bed was also nice, but if you're tall (over 6ft) it's a little hard to sleep two, other than that, it's a great place to stay!

Great location, small (for 3people), but  nice room. Mayra is great, helps a lot, you can always contact her during the stay if anything would be missing. Very quiet at night despite the central location.

Mayra is the sweetest person ever. She was very communicative throughout my stay. I was in NYC to find an apartment, and she volunteered her time and advice. The apartment itself is right in the center of downtown Manhattan, very easy for commute purposes, but it's a 4 flight walk up, so be ready for that. The building itself is kind of dirty, very small hallways, but the apartment was very clean. Great little getaway!

Mayra was a fantastic host! My friend and I booked her place for a girl's weekend to attend a concert that was at MSG, and we could not have asked for a better experience. Mayra always kept in contact with us throughout our stay to make sure that we were doing alright, and she even sent us a few recommendations of things that were happening in the city that weekend. Her apartment was PERFECT, both in terms of location and interior decor :) There were so many good food places within walking distance and needless to say, we definitely indulged in the food that East Village had to offer. We loved the dynamics and the bustling atmosphere of the area, and Mayra's hospitality enhanced our experience tenfold. We would definitely consider booking her place again. Thanks so much Mayra, you're the best!

Absolutely perfect location, and ironically very quite in the appartment. The place it self was clean and cosy. All communication with Mayra went smoothly, we didnt get to meet her but she seems vey nice.

Mayra was an excellent host and provided us with some really helpful information regarding the Jazz, Music and Food scene in the area. 
The apartment is perfect - you really do feel like you have the apartment to yourself as the other flat mate is very rarely there. 
The Highlights - 
Extremely close to the Subway. 
No noise and beautiful light in the apartment. 
In the heart of the East Village - the coolest part of Manhattan New York. 
Awesome Yoga Classes ($10 Recommended Donation) at Yoga for the People - 50m down the road. 
Live Jazz every night at Jules - 200m down the road. 
$1 Pizza at Two Bros Pizza - 10m down the road. 
You will definitely have an awesome time and we would recommend this place to anyone :)

We didn't meet Mayra during our 6 night stay but she stayed in contact with us the whole time making sure we had enough things.

Dominic her flatmate was there but I never saw him and Debra only saw him once. 

The room was nice and cosy. The area was fantastic and lots of places around East Village to eat. We only tried a few but recommend Crifdogs, Pudding and Barcade was a fun bar/arcade place.

Everything we needed was provided, the bathroom was especially warm which was important as it was quite cold weather during our visit.

Would recommend staying here due to the great location and cleanliness.

Io e mie sorelle siamo state per 4 notti nell'appartamento di Mayra. Non l'abbiamo mai incontrata anche se via email e via messaggio è stata molto disponibile a fornirci tutte le informazioni richieste. Anche il suo coinquilino era via e quindi abbiamo avuto la massima privacy. La posizione dell'appartamento è sicuramente ottima in quanto si trova in una bella zona di New York e a pochi passi dalla stazione della metropolitana da cui partire per esplorare la città.
L'arredamento è un po' modificato rispetto alle foto e quindi in realtà la camera risultava un po' più piccola per la presenza di un divano, che però è stato utile in quanto l'abbiamo utilizzato come terzo letto.
La pulizia non era al top, soprattutto quella del palazzo lasciava a desiderare.
Come specificato nell'annuncio, ci sono quattro piani di scale, strette e alte, da fare prima di arrivare all'appartamento: utili per fare ginnastica!
Per chi soggiorna in autunno/inverno: la camera e soprattutto il bagno sono caldissimi perché il riscaldamento è altissimo!

We had a great time at Mayra's home. The apartment was clean and safe, and the location couldn't be better! We were close to a number of awesome cafes and restaurants. Being 2 blocks away from the Astor Place metro station was a plus as well. We had some trouble finding the exact spot, but you'll find it if you look closely enough!
Thank you Mayra for all your help and for being so attentive, the flat was very nice!

Mayra was super responsive and helpful; I felt very well taken care of even though we never met. Her apartment is very clean and the location is great. The building was kind of shabby and old but it's in a really safe part of town close to loads of food options. The bedroom is really warm, so bring cool weather pajamas! I was afraid the bed would be small for two but it was pretty spacious.

Mayra is a great host, even though we did not actually meet her she was very responsive via emails and she had arranged everything that was needed for us to easily find the apartment and get the keys.
The apartment itself is very nice and very well heated, overall everything was very good.
Location is one of the best you can get, it is just about 10 minutes walk to subway so you can easily get wherever you need on nyc by subway. There are also a lots of bars, clubs, shops, restaurants and cafes in the district.
I would recommend this place to others.

Mayra was great with communication - very easy to find the place, get in, and leave etc. We never saw the other roommate which meant it felt like we had the place to ourselves. Lovely, very clean little apartment - only comment would be that the bed is a climb-up and separated from the communal kitchen by a curtain so probably not ideal for older people or a couple! Fine for us though (two friends). Neighborhood is wonderful for getting around Manhattan and Williamsburg, but the street is a bit rough - lots of tattoo places and take out joints - and the building corridors smell and are dirty... fine once you get inside apartment but again might not suit older people! Thank you Myra for a great trip!!

Loved our time in NY! Mayra was so helpful and lovely to deal with and easy to get hold of! The location is the best - great street with loads of character and only 2 min walk to subway. Apartment is quiet, cozy and the bed was so comfy! Would definitely stay again.

The appartement has a great location as it is close to subway stations and as it is in fact close to some very nice neighbourhoods such as soHo. Although we faced difficulties about heating and hot water which were due to an explosion in the area, Mayra tried her best to compensate for the inconvenience. She recommended us some restaurants and bars which turned out to be nice ones. She was reachable via (Hidden by Airbnb) all the time.

The best thing about Mayra's place is the location - it is a great base for exploring Manhattan and good transport options nearby. There are many fun dive bars nearby and plenty of eateries for all budgets. The building itself was quite old and the flat is very basic and cleanliness of the flat was okay. However, if you are visiting NYC, Mayra's apartment is a great value for money for central location.
Impresiona el ingreso pero el departamento es agradable

Värden Mayra Lujan tog emot mig på ett utmärkt sympatiskt sätt. Hon berättade om lägenheten och omgivningarna och gav mig mängder med olika tips och var behjälplig. Beskrivningen av boende stämde väl överens med verkligheten, även om jag trodde att kvaliteten på boendet skulle vara högre; jag hade t ex inte förstått att det var en våningssäng. Duschen fungerade inte riktigt. Av den anledningen lämnade jag boende tre dagar tidigare. Men läget är fantastiskt i East Village.

The location Of the apartment is super, you're right in the middle of everything. All worked out smoothly, we didn't get to meet Mayra but she answered fast on any kind of questions via (Hidden by Airbnb) . 
But the apartment itself is not at all as shown on the pictures. The windows were extremely dirty and you could not close them. (Luckily it was hot so we needed fresh air ;)) 
The sheets were clean and the bed was good (we slept like babies!) but apart from that we did not want to spend a lot of time there. 
Especially the bathroom was dirty and the shower worked very poorly. 
It is really disappointing when you compare the pictures to the reality. 
All in all we had a great time in NYC but that was definitely not due to the apartment.

The location of the room is best to explore NY. Mayra was always available when we had any questions, although we did not see her. Her room mate was not in the flat during our stay.
The room is in the 4th floor, with baggage quite exhausting...

Mayra was always available and the location is great. The street is very noisy but the apartment was quiet.
But the pictures doesn't match with the reality, the room had no furnitures and the apartment and the sheets was dirty, the shower no more pressure. Mayra was reactive about this problem but I was disappointed about the apartment. It's a pity because it could be better.

Appartement bien situé et calme par rapport à la rue, par contre nous avons trouvé l'appartement et les draps sales et la douche sans aucune pression, Mayra qui est très disponible et réactive a réglé ses problèmes sous 2 jours mais je reste assez déçue les photos ne correspondent pas à la réalité
The room is really nice, and Mayra was extremely helpful. The location is great, close to the University, restaurants, and the subway station. I enjoyed the stay a lot.

Although we didn’t meet Mayra was a very nice and helpful host, provided us all the needed information. The communication with her was easy and quick just as the check-in and the check-out. The apartment is in a great surrounding, right in the heart of the East Village, surrounded by great restaurants, bars and cool places. It is a good starting point to discover the city by foot, or you can also get on the Metro easily as it is a few blocks away.
The apartment is on the 4th floor so be prepared for climbing the steps :) If you prefer privacy this place may not be the right choice for you as the room is not fully separated – there is a window between the room and the kitchen, divided by a curtain. The flatmate of Mayra (and maybe his girlfriend too) lives there as well. We didn’t meet much but somebody was home mostly when we got back. The flat was a bit messy, especially the bathroom.

Mayra was very approachable and sent all information ahead. The flat was in a fab location, but unfortunately the state of the flat wasn't very great at all. It was very run down, water flooding from the shower, there were no pots to cook and no hob so you better eat out which for us meant spending more money than originally intended. We did not get the room on the picture but instead a very simple room with 1 bed, 1 sofa, 1 cupboard. Not cosy or personal in any way and our main roommates were not the one mentioned (who had left when we arrived although he was still introduced to us via email) but 2 other Airbnber's and several pidgeons constantly sitting and screaming outside of the window.  If you only intend to be here for the hours you sleep it's OK. But it does not make you feel homely so if you intend to spend time in the AirBnB itself, cook,  and hang out you may not like it here.

The short- I would not recommend this apartment to anyone.  For what it offers, it's significantly over priced. 

The long- This was my first time trying AirBnB and I feel terrible to have dragged my family along for the experience.  The front entrance smelled of piss and the hallway inside wasn't any better.  At the base of the steps inside is where the building's trash is thrown, it seems, but rather than cans of trash, it was a pile of garbage overflowing into the hallway.   Then came trouble with the apartment door/lock.  My family tried at it for 10-15 minutes before we decided to call Mayra because it was definitely a problem with the door, not us.  Luckily, Mayra was readily accessible by phone, but even her detailed directions couldn't help us in.  She offered to come by to open the apartment door, which was nice, but now we were left waiting in the dirty narrow halls for 40 minutes.  It was about 8:30pm when we called by the way...  everything thus far was very disheartening, especially after a long and tiring day of exploring New York.  During our 40 minute wait, we found that we were in the company of 4 rats scurrying back and forth through the pile of trash.  When Mayra arrived, she too admitted it was normally difficult to open the door..  It just so happened that the door was being extra difficult with us.  Hopefully, this is not a problem with future AirBnBers.  Once inside, we did not feel anymore comfortable- it was not what the pictures showed at all!  I've stayed in many hostels over the years and I would equate the state of this apartment to the most decrepit, poorly kept hostel I've ever stayed in.  We avoided using anything in the house as none of it felt clean, i.e. the kitchen, the bathroom, and shower especially.  And although the beds were made, the sheets didn't feel clean either.  To end our night, we took the recommendation of leaving the windows open for a nice breeze, but instead we were swarmed by mosquitoes throughout the night.  We were so thankful we only booked for one night!  Couldn't have gotten out any faster the next morning.

I realize the state of the building and some other factors are out of Mayra's control, but these are things I wish I knew before we stayed.  

The price we paid was $250/night.  For anyone looking to stay in New York, I would like to say that you can find much better.  Our 3 days prior, in a very nice hotel, and 4 days after, in another apartment through AirBnB, were both were amazing and cheaper!

For more about the apartment, I recommend reviews left by Kellea (same apt, other listing) and Jeff & Faith.  Their reviews were very accurate regarding my experience.

Lastly, this review is is no way speaking of Mayra.  She was an extremely nice host, unfortunately, her apartment happened to be the complete opposite.
Everything about this place was awesome. Great area with a lot of bars and places to eat. Loved it. Would definitely go again.

I really liked this apartment in East Village. 
fyi the building is old and the stairs are narrow. 
What mattered most was that the apartment itself was clean and comfortable. 
Towels, soap, kitchen stuff was all provided. 
I met Lorena when we arrived. She's a really nice person and meeting her made me feel more comfortable staying at her place. 
East Village is awesome for young people especially. It's also a great place to be because of transportation. Walking anywhere around Manhattan doesn't take that long from East Village. I'd definitely recommend it and would stay here again.

Excelente lugar y atención fenomenal. La ubicación del departamento es increíble, lleno de opciones de vida nocturna y comida. A una cuadra del metro y caminando de Brooklyn Bridge. 

Lorena fue muy amable y nos ayudo a seleccionar las mejores opciones para nuestro viaje. 

Esta ha sido mi mejor experiencia de AirBnb, gracias Lorena!

I had a great stay at this apartment!! It is located in one of my favorite spots in NYC (the east village) and potentially the most busiest and coolest street in the east village itself (St. Marks!). It was really great to be in the center of it all.  Lorena was also a really great host - super responsive when I needed something and very forthcoming with great suggestions. She clearly has a passion for living in NYC!

Despite being a very busy neighborhood, the room is surprisingly quiet which was great =). The room itself is a nice well-lit space that has a bed and couch. Note that the building is quite old so the entry stairwell and door has some graffitti and appears a little rundown - but I didn't really mind this at all and thought it added to the charm of the overall place. Fair warning: If you are very conscious of the outer facade of where you are staying - you may not share my optimism.

All in all, considering the location, price, space, and ease - I would wholeheartedly recommend this amazing find!
She's been a wonderful host, very helpful giving us suggestions on places to eat in the neighborhood. The house was lovely and well positioned in the city. We had such a good time!

The place is good and location is amazing! Only about 10-15 minutes to walk to shopping area and subway is very close also. There were many different kind of restaurants and pubs near. Mayra was so nice and easygoing. Everything went well, also early check in. If I someday come back to New York I will definetely stay here again!
After a small mix up at the beginning of our stay, Lorena really came through to ensure that our stay in New York was excellent. Thank you for all your help and cooperation.

Well at first it seemed like everything was going to be great I paid for two beds in one room. Until last minute she sends me a text saying that her dear friend (3) was going to be in the apartment for just one night. So when I got into NYC she told me the room to ur right is the room I walk in its one bed she said gave the room I paid for to her friend and stuck me and my friend in the other room which I found to be very annoying. So after going out I bring friends of my over they don't stay the night. She send me an email saying she know it's not in her house rules but not to bring people over I said sorry.  obviously Her friends said something. That night her friends bring someone over and they are loud and don't sleep until 3am drinking beers btw the room we have is off the kitchen and has a window into the kitchen. They were speaking Spanish. Not knowing that I spoke Spanish. They were being very rude and ended up staying two night they also woke up at 6am to leave honestly if I knew it was going to be like this I would of paid for a hotel instead. This was my first time using Airbnb and my first time in the city.

Wir waren drei Maedels fuer 10 Naechte in dem Apratment. Es hat alles perfekt geklappt, die Beschreibung und Informationen waren super und stimmten genau. Das Haus ist alt und die Treppen steil, aber das hat uns ueberhaupt nicht gestoert. Das Apartment ist super, sowohl fuer Kurztrips als auch fuer laengere Aufenthalte. Die Lage ist grandios. Lorena wollte Anfangs zwei weitere Maedels im Wohnbereich unterbringen. Allerdings fanden wir das zu viel, da wir uns dann zu fuenft Kueche und Bad haetten teilen muessen. Sie hat dann aber schnell eine andere Loesung gefunden. Anfangs hatten wir wegen Bauarbeiten kaltes Wasser, sie hat uns netterweise Ihr Apratment zum Duschen angeboten, was sehr freundlich war. Lorena selbst haben wir nicht getroffen, aber wir hatten auch einen vollen Zeitplan :-). An unserem letzten Abend bekamen wir dann noch einen Mitbewohner, was aber fuer die eine Nacht ueberhaupt kein Problem war.
Wir wuerden jederzeit wieder bei Lorena uebernachten. Einer meiner besten Urlaube, wahnsinns Stadt und super gelegenes Apartment. Vielen Dank!!!

We did not meet Mayra. The room and flat were exactly as shown in the pictures, and were very clean and tidy.  We shared the flat with her friends (a couple) in the next room. The arrangement would have been fine but we received no notice about her friends until we had already checked in. 

The location of the building was excellent, in the heart of the East Village. Mayra also accommodated our late checkout.

This is a prime location in East Village and the apartment is really clean and pleasant. It is a private room in an apartment with two bedrooms, and the other bedroom is also listed on AirBnB (rather than it being a room in the host's apartment). That makes it quite interesting, if you are traveling with a larger group you can try to get both rooms.
Lorena was very easy to communicate with, the keys were easy to retrieve and things could not have been better.

Malheureusement, nous n'avons pas pu rencontrer Lorena durant notre séjour, mais elle a su être joignable en tout temps. Le logement était parfaitement semblable aux photos, bien qu'un peu petit. Le quartier était très vivant, la rue très agréable. Il y a une grande quantité de restaurants et d'épiceries à quelques minutes à pieds.
Appartement bien situé et calme mais pas très propre

We had a great time in New York! Apartment is really cute and surrounded by many restaurants, shops and bars. 
Location is perfect for tourists, almost everything in walking distance. 
Great communication :)

Dutch, English see below: De kamer was klein voor 3 personen maar niet te klein. We hadden geen hoge verwachtingen aangezien het New York is maar het was echt een relax verblijf. De kamer is goed ingericht en stil. Het appartement van alle gemakken voorzien. We hebben genoten van ons verblijf in deze zeer leuke wijk. Goed bereikbaar en savonds genoeg te doen op loopafstand, vooral voor onze leeftijd 30. 
De communicatie met lorena was goed, ze reageert snel en behulpzaam. Echt een aanrader. 
(English: The room is small for three persons but not too small. Our expectations weren't high because it's New York but it was a really relax stay. The room is well decorated and reallly quiet. The apartment has all it needs. We really enjoyed our stay in this great and amazing neighborhood, especially for our age around 30, a lot to do in the evening an walking distance.
The communication with Lorena is great she replays fast and helpful. An real recommendation. )

This apartment is in a prime East Village location with so much to do and see. The apartment is very clean and comfortable. It's also nice to be so close to the subway. This place is a great find and we'd stay again.

This was my first Airbnb experience and it was fantastic! Lorena was wonderful to correspond with from the very first message. Her place was exactly as shown in the pictures. The location was incredible--the middle of the East Village. There were 5 of us and we never felt too cramped. She was very thorough on all details and responsive on any and all questions. I would love to stay at her place again--my friends and I were sad to leave!
El apartamento está bien situado y muy bien preparado. Ademas no hacia nada de frio en el, ya que la calefacción funcionaba de continuo.

Lorena's (Mayra) appartment was a nice nice and cozy place right in the middle of New York. Best still quiet. I never met Mayra personally, but she was very welcoming and pleasant. I can recommend Mayra's place at St. Marks at any time.

El departamento cumple con lo prometido. Muy bien ubicado.
El departamento bastante limpio.

La entrada y pasillos del edificio muy sucios. Pasando el fuerte olor a orina en la puerta de entrada, mejora la situación. En los 4 dias que estuve ahí nunca vi limpieza a los pasillos. Las migas de cereales que estaban en el piso de la entrada el dia que llegue estuvieron ahí  los 4 días.


Lo que debe saber el posible arrendatario es que este edificio No  tiene ascensor. Tuve que subir por escaleras muy empinadas 2 maletas muy pesadas. Fue muy difícil!

Nous avons passé 1 semaine à 3 dans cet appartement avec mes filles de 16 et 18 ans, il est trés bien adapté à du court séjour le ménage venait d'être fait lorsque nous sommes arrivé, il est bien éclairé et la vue sur la cour depuis le salon est vraiment super sympa, surtout le matin ou les écureuils viennent se nourrir sur la terrasse du voisin d'en face, génial, et en plus c'et hyper calme!!! l'appartement est trés fonctionnel, et le salon/chambre d'appoint n’étant pas utilisé pendant notre séjour, mayra nous a gentiment proposé de l'utiliser sans surcoût! la position géographique est TOP, à 5mn à peine du métro, ce qui permet d'atteindre n'importe quel endroit de NY en moins d'1/2h, le quartier est très animé mais sans problèmes, c'est vraiment un bon plan surtout si vous avez la chance de l'utiliser lorsqu'il est entièrement libre. nous n'avons pas rencontré Mayra pendant notre séjour mais elle a toujours su répondre  à nos questions, ce qui a vraiment contribué à la réussite de notre Séjour:
Apartment was great, clean and in a very good area. The place was within walking distance from food outlets, shopping and train stations. Would, and hopefully will, stay there again.
Fabulous location. Cute apartment. Plenty of space for multiple people. Host was attentativeand helpful. I had a great stay!

French speakers!!! Français lisez!!!
We had a great stay at Mayra's place. 
First of all, Mayra will write back to you very quickly!! She is very available and always willing to help you out with anything!
I stay there with my husband, my 5 month old baby, my brother and his wife and their 1 year old baby. Mayra was very nice to accept us to stay there cause many refused. 
The apartment was as described: very quite (sometimes you can hear the neighbors but that's everywhere) and cosy! The kitchen was very handy too! 
Very small bathroom, but that wasn't a problem! I actually thought it was pretty cute.
So it's on the forth floor, very steep stairs, BUT we did it with 2 babies AND 2 strollers!! so If we could do it so can you!! 
The area is absolutely great! A real New York experience! This is the whole package!!
I would definitely recommend this apartment to my friends and family!! :-)

Amis français, si vous voulez vivre une expérience typique New Yorkaise, je vous conseille vivement cet appartment au Coeur de Manhattan. The East Village est un super endroit pour découvrir New York, et  la rue de cet appartement est géniale pour ça.
Mayra est une personne très gentille et disponible, nous n'avons pas pu la rencontrer mais elle était toujours disponible par email!!
L'appartement est petit mais nous étions 2 couples et 2 bébés et ça s'est très bien passé! Il se trouve au 4ème étage, et là encore ça pourrait paraitre haut mais nous avons réussi avec 2 bébés et 2 poussettes alors si on peut, tout le monde peut!! 
Je vais recommender cet appart à ma famille et mes amis, je pense que ça veut tout dire!! :-)
Lorena's apartment is at a great location, and it is a cute apartment. She was really helpful and we absolutely enjoyed our stay!

Although we did not have a chance to meet Lorena, she was very accommodating, offering detailed instructions via e-mail. This made finding and entering the apartment very easy. The apartment is in a great location, with subways near by. Good size apartment, it was 4 of us and we had plenty of space. Overall nice stay, would probably stay here again.
Superbe appartement! Il est très bien situé joli quartier, très vivant. Bon rapport qualité prix. Lorena est très arrangeante pour la remise des clés.

The apartment does look exactly like the pictures and can definitely accommodate 6-7 people. However, you have to climb 4 flights of steep stairs to get in the apartment. Also, when we arrived it was a super hot day and there was no form of a/c so we had to look around and found a window unit and had install it ourselves. There was also a giant cockroach that ran across the floor. She sent a really helpful intro email that made the place really easy to find however she did not respond the entire stay or reach out to make sure everything was okay. The location was perfect though!

Great apartment in a fun and funky neighborhood!  We really enjoyed starting and finishing our day in the East Village.  There are lots of great restaurants in the neighborhood and the subway is close by.

Great apartment and great location. Easy to get in and out. Stayed here as an instant booking which I got at mid-night the night before. Host was great and provided everything I needed.  Would definitely stay here again.

Lorena was great with communication, information about the apartment and neighborhood, and had lots of ways to talk to her in case of an issue. The apartment and neighbors were quiet. Overall, a great stay.

What a fantastic location! This apartment was perfectly outfitted for our group of three on a long weekend in NYC. Very clean and everything you need! Lorena was a great and communicative host! Super easy check in an check out process. Will definitely stay here again.
The neighborhood was perfect to explore. The apartment was very small, but fine for one night. The host was easily reached if needed!
Great location, accurate listing, and easy stay in the heart of NYC. I would definitely recommend this apartment to anyone looking explore the east village and get a feel for city living.

This Airbnb definitely lived up to its advertisement.  It is a cute apartment in a great location.  The apartment is near several useful trains to get around the city, and there are lots of great affordable eateries immediately nearby.

A couple of things to note: It is a fourth floor walk up in the European style of numbering in that the ground floor is not the first floor.  This was fine for me, but might be a deal breaker for some.  The bathroom was small but not inconvenient.  As a larger individual I would have preferred more room.  Those are about the only things that I could call negatives.

Lorena, the host, was excellent.  She was very communicative and prompt with answers to questions.  The place was clean, well stocked in regards to bedding, toiletries, towels, etc... and there was ample space for seven of us.

When available, it is an excellent choice for an affordable stay in New York.
Lorena was great! She checked in with us and made sure all was well.
The apartment was located in a great spot in the city, close to many late night activities.  The apartment was a peaceful refuge from the hustle and bustle and allowed for a great sleep.

I will start off on a positive note, our host was great. She was very fast to respond to all my messages. I will say that this apartment is in a very fun area. Lots of restaurant and bars and very close to multiple subway lines. The building is in poor shape. Very dirty.  The apartment itself was clean. I recommend that you request a picture of the bathroom before booking. If I had seen the bathroom, I would have never booked.  It is very small. The shower knobs, when turned, feel like they will fall off. The angle of the showerhead makes the water go to the bathroom floor.  The sink is so small that we had to wash our faces in kitchen sink. Just some advice.

Points positifs : appartement spacieux pour une famille de 4 personnes bien situé pour rayonner dans Manhattan, et bien insonorisé compte tenu du quartier bruyant. Bien équipé. Climatisation dans les 2 chambres indispensable l'été. Bon rapport qualité-prix.
Points négatifs : immeuble vétuste et sale. Difficulté pour avoir de l'eau chaude à la douche. Appartement moins lumineux et plus vieux que ce qu'il parait  sur les photos.
Point non mentionné dans l'annonce pouvant avoir son importance : appartement au 4eme étage sans ascenseur, pas de photo de la salle de bain très étroite.
Just as advertised. Easy to check in and out and the host, Lorena is super responsive and helpful. Would highly recommend.
Great apartment in interesting neighborhood. The apartment had everything we needed and the beds were comfortable. There was great directions and it was easy to find. Loved it!

Such a perfect location, really easy to get around. Host was great to contact and replied super quick. We went when it was super hot in August but apartment was fine because it had aircon. Like most New York apartments we just had to walk up some stairs to get to our place. All ammenities were great, and we didn't need to change sheets or wash as that was provided with the cost. Definetly recommend to a friend visiting New York for the first time!
Excellent Location!!

My wife and daughter stayed at the apartment and found the apartment interior itself to be very charming and the neighborhood to be colorful, as described.  However, once you enter the building, the common areas are in very poor condition and appear very rough and dirty.  

The sleeping accommodations were fine, but as two women traveling together the fact that one of the AC units was placed in a window on a fire escape, held in place with duct tape easily removable by anyone who might have access to the fire escape from the outside, was disconcerting.  It was a very quiet and private apartment space, but it came as a surprise to us on the second day when Lorena informed us that painting and tile work was scheduled for the apartment later that day.  She assured us it was a minor repair but we objected and we were told that the work could wait.

The stay worked out despite some hurdles.
Great location! Great contact! Cute apartment. Very flexible

The apartment is located around a lot of great places for food. If you are a food lovers like me and my friends, this place is a must. There are so many good food around this apartment. It's a little far Time Square if you want to walk. But if you take the metro there's a metro nearby and it's super convenient. Also Lorena is super responsive via (Hidden by Airbnb) . I asked her multiple times on (Hidden by Airbnb) and get the response pretty quick. Also she provided us the map and instructions before we arrived and it's really helpful. It was a pleasure to stay there.
Very small apartment, neat location, would be great for a couple who are ok with four flights of stairs (in a rundown East Village building). Host's arrival instructions were clear and comprehensive.

If your want to live like a local Lorenas cute comfortable apartment is perfect. Everything was easy for us. Central to everthing close to subways..easy to get to Brooklyn as well.
Great coffee and calmness at Coffee Project to start the day.
The apartment is clean and beds comfortable. Plenty of light for this stly of living. 
We met the lovely Lorena and wish her well.

Got to the apartment very late so the lockbox for the key was super convenient.
The apartment was ok, considering we used it only for sleeping there and weren't spending time there at all.

I would probably recommend this place to a family with kids and not for two couples like we were.

The building is not in a very good condition, very dirty and the stairs are very slippery, I fell really bad there :(

Laurena was helpful and responsive when we had questions! 
The apartment was clean too.

Thanks !

Fantastic apartment in great location, perfect for what we were after.  Lorena was very helpful and welcoming.  Would happily stay there again.
Thanks Lorena!

Wir sind Abends in Apartment angekommen und haben direkt einen unangenehmen Geruch bemerkt. Da Die Gastgeberin mit einem Zettel am Kühlschrank verbietet, die Fenster zu öffnen, sind wir diesen auch nicht wirklich los geworden. Die Zimmer sind durch türen schließbar, welche über dem Türrahmen ein großes Loch aufweist. Überall sind Kabel und Ablußrohre mitten durch die Zimmer verteilt. Das Apartment erscheint allgemein ziemlich dreckig und abgewöhnt (kaputte Möbelstücke) Das schlimmste ist allerdings das Bad! Eine kleine Nasszelle, mit einem Mini-Waschbecken (eher für ein Gäste-WC gedacht) und einer schimmeligen Dusche!
Wir haben noch am selben Abend Kontakt mit der Gastgeberin und Airbnb aufgenommen. Die Gastgeberin hat auf unsere Nachricht nicht reagiert. Dank der schnellen Bearbeitung durch Airbnb dürften wir am nächsten Tag unseren Aufenthalt stornieren und umziehen!
I spent a very nice time there and Lorena was very kind and helpful. Thanks a lot!

Lorena was very helpful answering questions and providing directions. This apartment is in a very vibrant neighborhood and yet is amazingly quiet. One of the quietest NYC places I have stayed. As mentioned by others, the entryway and stairs are well worn, but the apartment is clean and neat.
My host left explicit instructions on how to get to the place and how to access the apartment. This made the arrival comfortable and a seamless transition.
The apartment was small but cozy. Location is great and easy access to lots of good food. Lorena herself was responsive and vey welcoming!

Lorena went out of her way to ensure we had all information at hand for our stay in New York. This apartment was clean, tidy and welcoming.

Perfect location for shopping, food & culture.

Could not fault this place :)

Looking forward to staying here again on my next trip!
Great place! Walking distance to a lot of places and good communication with Lorena.
Lovely little place suitable for young travelers looking to live like a local! It was kind of drafty, though. Windows let out a lot of heat
Quartier très vivant de l'East side avec de nombreux cafés et restos dans la rue

Location is very convenient and have two comfortable beds and two sofa. But the bathroom may be too small for some big guy, everyone need to be attention touch the hot water pipes when you are taking a shower.

Great location and a lovely apartment. Lorena was super helpful, and very accommodating. I was off my game this week and pinged her more than I typically do with hosts, and she was very responsive and friendly every time. For me, it was quick access to the 6 which was fantastic considering how cold it was this week. Apartment has everything you need and very spacious.

We loved this apartment right in the heart of the east village. It was like entering a little oasis of comfort and quiet from the bustling street below. And cafes and restaurants are all along the street so you're right in the middle of things. The apartment had 3 double beds and a sofa so our family of 4 had plenty of space. We basically just slept there and found the beds very comfortable. But if we'd wanted to cook, the kitchen was pretty sizable with a table & 4 chairs. It was easy to pick up and drop off the key and to communicate with the owner. All and all, a great experience!

Lorena's place is great for maybe 6 people max. It is a cute apartment in a nice location. Her apartment is on the 4th floor of a run down building with no elevator, so it was quite the exercise going up and down the stairs. Three issues I had were a clogging toilet, the wifi network not being able to be found, and the door buzzer not working. These things can be improved though and not a major issue. 

Lorena seems like a nice person though and responsive.

Location was great and getting the keys was also very easy. It definitely felt small and narrow, but I guess that's New York. The apartment can comfortably sleep 4, but it gets crowded very fast with more people.

La casa è in una bellissima zona, st mark è una via molto viva e piena di ristoranti. Si arriva facilmente a piedi nel cuore del west village. 
Lorena non l'ho mai vista, ci siamo sempre e solo sentiti su whatsap. Mi aspettavo più indicazioni sul chek in, abbiamo avuto un po di difficoltà con il chek in del keycafe ( degli armadietti dove puoi prendere e lasciare le chiavi ) .
Ha dato per scontato che sapessimo come fare, basta un po di intuito e te la cavi, ma il servizio keycafe ha funzionato davvero male perché l'armadietto non si apriva. Abbiamo perso 1 ora a chiamare il servizio clienti. Stesso discorso con il deposito a fine vacanza. 
La casa non è un gran che: bagno piuttosto piccolo e scomodo. Le stanze accettabili. Molte scale da fare.

Nous avons eu des problèmes d'eau chaude et de chauffage lors de notre séjour. Les fenêtres ne sont pas isolées (il y a des trous à côté du climatiseur) et laissaient entrer l'air froid (nous avions des températures négatives à New York lors de notre séjour).
Le problème a mis du temps à être traité et n'a pas été réglé entièrement.

Stayed one week at Lorena's place. There is enough room for more than 3 persons. The place wasn't very clean, missing soap and shampoo, but on the other hand, it was warm and cosy, great location. Lorena was super responsive and picking up the key was very easy!!
Bathroom is super tiny, and very tricky to maneuver especially if you're a big guy.
El depa está bien. Funcional, sin lujos. El edificio es viejo y las escaleras son empinadas, pero está muy bien ubicado. Debería mejorar el wifi, que es lento e inestable.
Quartiere molto carino e vivace, comodo per gli spostamenti. L'appartamento è pulito, la vista ed il palazzo lasciano un po'di a desiderare ma nel complesso è andato tutto molto bene

Nous avons passé un très bon séjour dans cet appartement. L'emplacement est génial à proximité du métro et des bars restaurants animés pour le soir.
Nous conseillons vivement cet endroit pour les gens qui veulent explorer New York sous toutes ses coutures.
Très bon contact avec l'hôte.

+ : Great location, clean flat, very close to restaurants and subway, many details from Lorena before the stay.
- : no elevator, very steep stairways, dirty building, shower not convenient (risk of flood :) )

L'appart de Lorena est très bien situé, dans une rue super sympa avec bars et restos. Proche de stations de métro, n'importe quel point de Manhattan est à quelques minutes!
Lorena a été réactive. Elle a toujours répondu à nos interrogations.
L'appart n'est pas haut de gamme, mais ça reste un très bon rapport qualité-prix!

great location but a bit noisy since it's on a popular street. plenty of beds, but not much else. the second "bedroom" (with the loft bed) is actually the living room. small. enough beds to sleep 7 max if you include the couch (not a pullout). no hot water in the morning for some reason. host was very communicative and helpful.

The apartment is located at a perfect location. 3-min walking distance to green line, and 4-min walking distance to orange line. There are a lot of good restaurants and bars opening till midnight around the neighborhood so dining is very convenient. There are 2 rooms in the apartment; the spacious main room is at the back side of the apartment so is quiet at night; we didn't use the other one which is at the street side so couldn't tell if it's quiet enough at night but we definitely could hear the voice from street at day time. The floor, kitchen and the sofa are not very clean but the condition is acceptable. The bathroom is very tiny and the showering water quite easily floods out of the shower area so the bathroom mat was is wet. The apartment is on 4F without elevator, and the stairs space is quite narrow so it's a bit dizzy after climbing for 4 floors. The public area of the building is quite dirty. We didn't meet the host in person but she was easily to reach and communicate. In terms of cost/performance of the apartment, we think it's a little bit expensive considering the size and condition of the apartment but I guess that's what it takes to stay in a such a good area in New York.
公寓位于曼哈顿东村,前往各旅游景点方便,房东热情,及时给我们提供各种交通出行信息,纽约的房屋都是有百年历史的老房子,公寓周边超市､酒吧､各类餐馆很多,非常方便,总之,这是一次愉快的体验,谢谢房东!

Cool location. Easy key pick up (try their pierogis). Easy communication, although little was needed. Pretty much as advertised. The loft bed where I slept was comfortable. Shower was tight and hard to keep from leaking water on floor with direction the shower head was pointed. Lots to do and eat about. Basic, affordable easy place to stay in the city.
Lorena's very flexible and responsive. The apartment is quiet and in a fun location.
Great central location, sleeps 4+ with beds, couches, futons. Key coordination very easy with Key Cafe, and Lorena was very communicative.
Key retrieval was easy.  Communication was good. As noted, it is a walk-up.

Lorena's place was a great find in the Lower East Side! I stayed with friends for the weekend and we all found the place perfect for our needs - close to restaurants, night life, spacious enough for 4 people and an AC unit in each room. St. Marks Pl. is a happening street to be on with many fun things to do in the neighborhood. Do note that the apartment is on the fourth floor, so getting luggage up there can be a bit tough.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Simply put: this is how you want an airbnb to be. Easy check in, collection of keys, and a great location that's in the heart of the city. The space had plenty of room for 4 adults and we enjoyed hanging in the apt. when we needed a break from the city streets. Despite a LOUD street outside, the apt. was really quiet inside and we slept great.

Pros - the apartment was very nice, had everything we needed and is in a fabulous location that was very convenient to the metro, shops, restaurants and a grocery market right across the street.  

Lorena seemed very nice. 

Cons - Lorena was traveling out of the country so her response time was slow sometimes a day because of different time zones. There was no designated local person for us to contact in case we had issues. All other times when we've stayed at airbnb if the owner was not in town, they've always had a local person there to meet us or a contact # of a local person for us to contact if we needed anything. 

Lorena had gotten new furniture after we had booked with her. The furniture was nice, but the new arrangement resulted in one less bed. When we booked we were specifically needing 3 bed apartments, which was this apartment originally. But we ended up with only 2 beds,  That was a bit disappointing. 

Finally, when we arrived a man approached us wanting us to tell him exactly what apartment unit we were staying in. Being a complete stranger to us and on the street, we wouldn't tell him. The conversation got a little confrontational and he proceeded to tell us it was illegal to rent out airbnb and that he was the superintendent. Still with no id, we did not tell him where we were staying. I did contact Lorena who got back with me the next morning, due to time differences, and was able to verify the man was the superintendent but also verified it was perfectly legal for her to rent out through airbnb. 
It was just an odd encounter that started our stay feeling a little uneasy. I was glad Lorena was able to verify who he was.
As advertised, great place in a great part of town! Lorena was super easy to reach, and all went smoothly during check-in. The apartment was nice, clean, and it made for a great stay in the city.
The location is fantastic! Surrounded by lots of Asian restaurants! Thoughtful note are everywhere in the house!but the photo is a great different and the check out cause some problems!

Lorena was very helpful. The apartment is very cute and welcoming, and our stay was great! There were some issues with keycafe but this is only because we tried accessing the keys before the set time. The area around the apartment is very lively with lots of things to do on the street. I would love to stay again, I definitely recommend staying with Lorena.
Perfect location ! Very close to all the train stations. Lorena was very reactive.
Great place for the price!
Magnífico emplazamiento. Perfecto para dos parejas.
Very nice stay. Good location.

For most Mayra makes the stay easy flawless, from getting the keys to communication. The neighborhood and location is supreme and well connected in Manhattan, and the neighbor is very vibrant and happening. For such a happening place, the apartment is serene, quiet, and with good lighting. You can see the trees on the backyard and find calm in New York. The house is also well equipped, has good instructions, and it makes you feel at home. Thanks Mayra.

The apartment was not really what it seemed to be in the photos. The bathroom smelled of must and was not clean at all. When I woke up I had a dozen bites on my hands which resembles those of bed bug bites. The host was not communicative about the problems I was dealing with the place and I feel somewhat scammed for what I was looking for. Would not recommend this place.

Mayra was so helpful. She sent us a ton of recommendations and was always available to respond if you needed anything. She accommodated to our trip in any way she needed and was so generous to everything in her apartment! The place was so nice it was very stylish and in the perfect location. I wouldn’t change anything about this place it was a solid 10/10 experience. Thank you Mayra!

The host left us freshly ground coffee which was a lovely touch. The apartment was very small but cute and comfortable. Definitely note that there are a lot of narrow stairs so carrying suitcases is difficult! The location was good and even though the street is busy, you cannot hear this in the apartment. Thanks for having us!

This space was amazing and in the best location! Lorena was so helpful with all of her helpful tips and information on the apartment and local area. We loved our stay so much we hope to return again. Perfect for a couple wanting a nice little romantic time in nyc.
Great location and charming place

I was pleasantly surprised both by how quiet and how sunny Lorena's place was, given its location on St Mark's. The location was great for getting around, and her place was very comfortable with pretty much everything you could want. I'd stay here again.
Located on a bohemian street, this place is perfectly located for everything you need and need to get to.  Clean, sunny, It was a pleasure staying there.

The space is located in a very cool neighborhood but we unfortunately did not get to stay in the space itself due to a problem getting the key. The host did take steps to try to remedy the situation including offering a free night stay  however due to some difficulties in timely communication we ended up staying at a different location.

There were both good things and bad things about my experience with this place. At first Lorena seemed very responsive and helpful and sent a lot of helpful instructions which was really nice to have when you travel to a new city and her place had some cute small touches in the common area oh and there’s an alexa which helps for playing music! The things I didn’t expect and threw me off:

We were getting there a bit sooner on our checkin day and I asked her the night before if I can drop my luggages 1-2 hours sooner and she said since no one booked the place that night I can check in as early in the morning so we took our heavy luggages there under the rain and the access code she gave me wasn’t working because she forgot to grant me early access and she didn’t answer any of my calls or texts until 6 hours after my check in!! Yes she didn’t have to do make me a favor but when your host tells you something you want to count on them! So we ended up wandering around under the rain for 2 hours in Manhattan with our heavy luggages! Anyways after I got the key I had to climb four floors to get to the apt (if you come to this place don’t bring anything more than a backpack) and the apartment looked much much smaller than the photos. But the worst part of my stay was sleeping in the bed. The pillow and the blankets were smelling musty! So we had to wear our jackets and use our towels to sleep through the night! Bottom line I won’t come back.
Perfect location! Cute and clean apartment!
Good location

name: Tara Cottage:a Haven for Relaxation
summary: An elegantly furnished cottage on park-like grounds with panoramic views of Kealakekua Bay. 'K Bay' with its unparalleled fine swimming, snorkeling & kayaking and the sacred Place of Refuge National Park are both a 10 min. drive from Tara.
space: Tara Cottage features a dramatic 300 sq. ft octagonal central room with a 15 ft apex and skylight. Furnishings include: a raised platform bed with an excellent queen mattress, Art Deco armoire, writing desk and a sitting area with an enclosed cabinet for cable TV/DVD.  There is a separate twin-beded room to accommodate a 3rd adult/older child. Tara Cottage is beautifully appointed with original artwork, fine furniture and Indonesian wood carvings and fabrics. You will also enjoy the excellent libraries of fine books, CDs and DVDs. The cottage provides high speed wifi, a full kitchen with outdoor propane BBQ and a Bosch washer and dryer. One showers outdoors in a dramatic lava rock grotto in a garden setting. The 'waterfall shower' is equipped with Grohe fixtures and side jets, for  a uniquely satisfying cleanse. Privacy is assured by bamboo fencing and the surrounding lush Thai bamboo.  On the ocean side of the cottage is a bi-level lanai with superb, unobstructed views of Kealakekua B

'K Bay' with its unparalleled fine swimming, snorkeling & kayaking and the sacred Place of Refuge National Park are both a 10 min. drive from Tara. Tara Cottage features a dramatic 300 sq. ft octagonal central room with a 15 ft apex and skylight. Furnishings include: a raised platform bed with an excellent queen mattress, Art Deco armoire, writing desk and a sitting area with an enclosed cabinet for cable TV/DVD.
